item.pokecube.quickcube.desc: §7Be quick to get that bonus success rate.
item.pokecube.timercube.desc: §7The more you wait, the better it gets.
item.pokecube.divecube.desc: §7Great for water types in their natural habitat.
item.pokecube.repeatcube.desc:
§7If you have caught the same type before, 
§7it will increase the chance of capture for another.
item.pokecube.lovecube.desc:
§7The love between your pokémob and a 
§7wild breeding pokémob will increase 
§7the chance of capture.
item.pokecube.heavycube.desc:
§7The heavier the pokémob, 
§7the greater the chance.
item.pokecube.levelcube.desc:
§7The higher the level, 
§7the higher the success.
item.pokecube.luxurycube.desc:
§7Increases happiness when the 
§7pokémob is out and about.
entity.pokecube.bulbasaur.dexDesc: For some time after its birth, it grows by taking nourishment from the seed on its back.
entity.pokecube.ivysaur.dexDesc: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower’s coming bloom.
entity.pokecube.venusaur.dexDesc: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémobs.
entity.pokecube.venusaur-gmax.dexDesc: In battle, this Pokémob swings around two thick vines. If these vines slammed into a 10-story building, they could easily topple it.
entity.pokecube.venusaur-mega.dexDesc: In order to support its flower, which has grown larger due to Mega Evolution, its back and legs have become stronger.
entity.pokecube.charmander.dexDesc: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If the Pokémob is healthy, its tail burns intensely.
entity.pokecube.charmeleon.dexDesc: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.
entity.pokecube.charizard.dexDesc: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.
entity.pokecube.charizard-gmax.dexDesc: The flame inside its body burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit. When Charizard roars, that temperature climbs even higher.
entity.pokecube.charizard-mega-x.dexDesc: The overwhelming power that fills its entire body causes it to turn black and create intense blue flames.
entity.pokecube.charizard-mega-y.dexDesc: Its bond with its Trainer is the source of its power. It boasts speed and maneuverability greater than that of a jet fighter.
entity.pokecube.squirtle.dexDesc: It hides in its shell to protect itself, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.
entity.pokecube.wartortle.dexDesc: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.
entity.pokecube.blastoise.dexDesc: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
entity.pokecube.blastoise-gmax.dexDesc: Water fired from this Pokémob's central main cannon has enough power to blast a hole into a mountain.
entity.pokecube.blastoise-mega.dexDesc: The cannon on its back is as powerful as a tank gun. Its tough legs and back enable it to withstand the recoil from firing the cannon.
entity.pokecube.caterpie.dexDesc: It releases a stench from its red antennae to repel enemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.
entity.pokecube.metapod.dexDesc: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. The Pokémob quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
entity.pokecube.butterfree.dexDesc: It loves the nectar of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.
entity.pokecube.butterfree-gmax.dexDesc: Crystallized Gigantamax energy makes up this Pokémob’s blindingly bright and highly toxic scales.
entity.pokecube.weedle.dexDesc: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.
entity.pokecube.kakuna.dexDesc: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.
entity.pokecube.beedrill.dexDesc: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.
entity.pokecube.beedrill-mega.dexDesc: Its legs have become poison stingers. It stabs its prey repeatedly with the stingers on its limbs, dealing the final blow with the stinger on its rear.
entity.pokecube.pidgey.dexDesc: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.
entity.pokecube.pidgeotto.dexDesc: It flies over its wide territory in search of prey, downing it with its highly developed claws.
entity.pokecube.pidgeot.dexDesc: This Pokémob flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.
entity.pokecube.pidgeot-mega.dexDesc: With its muscular strength now greatly increased, it can fly continuously for two weeks without resting.
entity.pokecube.rattata.dexDesc: It’s cautious in the extreme, and its hardy vitality lets it live in any kind of environment.
entity.pokecube.rattata-alola.dexDesc: When the sun goes down, it becomes active. It runs around town on a chase for good food for the boss of its nest—Raticate.
entity.pokecube.raticate.dexDesc: Its whiskers are essential for maintaining its balance. No matter how friendly you are, it will get angry and bite you if you touch its whiskers.
entity.pokecube.raticate-alola.dexDesc: This gourmet Pokémob is particular about the taste and freshness of its food. Restaurants where Raticate live have a good reputation.
entity.pokecube.spearow.dexDesc: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.
entity.pokecube.fearow.dexDesc: It has the stamina to fly all day on its broad wings. It fights by using its sharp beak.
entity.pokecube.ekans.dexDesc: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.
entity.pokecube.arbok.dexDesc: The pattern on its belly is for intimidation. It constricts foes while they are frozen in fear.
entity.pokecube.pikachu.dexDesc: Possesses cheek sacs in which it stores electricity. This clever forest-dweller roasts tough berries with an electric shock before consuming them.
entity.pokecube.pikachu-gmax.dexDesc: When it smashes its opponents with its bolt- shaped tail, it delivers a surge of electricity equivalent to a lightning strike.
entity.pokecube.raichu.dexDesc: It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity, instantly downing foes several times its size.
entity.pokecube.raichu-alola.dexDesc: This Pokémob rides on its tail while it uses its psychic powers to levitate. It attacks with star-shaped thunderbolts.
entity.pokecube.sandshrew.dexDesc: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.
entity.pokecube.sandshrew-alola.dexDesc: Life on mountains covered with deep snow has granted this Pokémob a body of ice that’s as hard as steel.
entity.pokecube.sandslash.dexDesc: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.
entity.pokecube.sandslash-alola.dexDesc: It uses large, hooked claws to cut a path through deep snow as it runs. On snowy mountains, this Sandslash is faster than any other Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.nidoran-f.dexDesc: While this Pokémob does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the venom it secretes from its barbs can be fatal.
entity.pokecube.nidorina.dexDesc: If the group is threatened, these Pokémobs will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.
entity.pokecube.nidoqueen.dexDesc: Its entire body is armored with hard scales. It will protect the young in its burrow with its life.
entity.pokecube.nidoran-m.dexDesc: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.
entity.pokecube.nidorino.dexDesc: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes venom upon impact.
entity.pokecube.nidoking.dexDesc: Its steel-like hide adds to its powerful tackle. Its horns are so hard, they can pierce a diamond.
entity.pokecube.clefairy.dexDesc: It can be found in quiet mountain areas on a full moon’s night. Its dancing and its tiny, faintly glowing wings confer upon it a lovely fairylike quality.
entity.pokecube.clefable.dexDesc: Legend says that on clear, quiet nights, it listens for the voices of its kin living on the moon.
entity.pokecube.vulpix.dexDesc: In its belly burns a fire, which Vulpix spits out in the form of fireballs. When young, this Pokémob has but one white tail. As the Pokémob matures, this single tail splits into six.
entity.pokecube.vulpix-alola.dexDesc: After long years in the ever-snowcapped mountains of Alola, this Vulpix has gained power over ice.
entity.pokecube.ninetales.dexDesc: Said to live for a thousand years, this Pokémob uses its supernatural abilities to manipulate fire. It can burn its prey to a crisp as it pleases.
entity.pokecube.ninetales-alola.dexDesc: It lives on mountains perpetually covered in snow and is revered as a deity incarnate. It appears draped in a blizzard.
entity.pokecube.jigglypuff.dexDesc: By freely changing the wavelength of its voice, Jigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to make any listener sleepy.
entity.pokecube.wigglytuff.dexDesc: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.
entity.pokecube.zubat.dexDesc: Makes its home in gloomy caves. Atrophied eyes have left this Pokémob blind, so it scans its surroundings via sound waves that it emits from its mouth as it flies.
entity.pokecube.golbat.dexDesc: It sinks its sharp fangs into other creatures and slurps up their blood. A closer look at the fangs reveals that they are hollow and akin to straws.
entity.pokecube.oddish.dexDesc: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.
entity.pokecube.gloom.dexDesc: The nectar it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious that it can make noses curl from more than a mile away.
entity.pokecube.vileplume.dexDesc: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
entity.pokecube.paras.dexDesc: Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug Pokémob host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.
entity.pokecube.parasect.dexDesc: Mushroom-lacking specimens of this Pokémob lie unmoving in the forest, lending credence to the hypothesis that the large mushroom is in control of Parasect’s actions.
entity.pokecube.venonat.dexDesc: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.
entity.pokecube.venomoth.dexDesc: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.
entity.pokecube.diglett.dexDesc: This Pokémob lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.
entity.pokecube.diglett-alola.dexDesc: The metal-rich geology of this Pokémob’s habitat caused it to develop steel whiskers on its head.
entity.pokecube.dugtrio.dexDesc: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.
entity.pokecube.dugtrio-alola.dexDesc: Their beautiful, metallic whiskers create a sort of protective helmet on their heads, and they also function as highly precise sensors.
entity.pokecube.meowth.dexDesc: It is nocturnal by nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter as brightly as the shiny object.
entity.pokecube.meowth-alola.dexDesc: Deeply proud and keenly smart, this Pokémob moves with cunning during battle and relentlessly attacks enemies’ weak points.
entity.pokecube.meowth-galar.dexDesc: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémob’s body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.
entity.pokecube.meowth-gmax.dexDesc: Its body has grown incredibly long and the coin on its forehead has grown incredibly large—all thanks to Gigantamax power.
entity.pokecube.persian.dexDesc: Getting this prideful Pokémob to warm up to you takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the moment it gets annoyed.
entity.pokecube.persian-alola.dexDesc: Its round face is a symbol of wealth. Persian that have bigger, plumper faces are considered more beautiful.
entity.pokecube.psyduck.dexDesc: As Psyduck gets stressed out, its headache gets progressively worse. It uses intense psychic energy to overwhelm those around it.
entity.pokecube.golduck.dexDesc: Its body is strong, and it has webbing on its hands and feet. Golduck can swim easily through rough seas, clawing its way through the high waves.
entity.pokecube.mankey.dexDesc: It lives in treetop colonies. If one member of the group becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
entity.pokecube.primeape.dexDesc: It becomes angry if it sees an opponent’s eyes and gets angrier if the opponent runs. Even after it beats the opponent, it is still angry.
entity.pokecube.growlithe.dexDesc: It is a Pokémob with a loyal nature. It will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.
entity.pokecube.growlithe-hisui.dexDesc: These Pokémobs live in packs in the snowy mountains and defend themselves with icy breath. This species changed its form to adapt to the frigid climate.
entity.pokecube.arcanine.dexDesc: A Pokémob that has long been admired for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.
entity.pokecube.arcanine-hisui.dexDesc: Dwells on sacred peaks perpetually covered in snow. Said to appear to virtuous people who have lost their way on mountain paths—it then guides them back down to the mountain’s base.
entity.pokecube.poliwag.dexDesc: Its skin is so thin, its internal organs are visible. It has trouble walking on its newly grown feet.
entity.pokecube.poliwhirl.dexDesc: The spiral pattern on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it gradually causes drowsiness.
entity.pokecube.poliwrath.dexDesc: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.
entity.pokecube.abra.dexDesc: Spends 18 hours of the day sleeping. Even while asleep, Abra can control its psychic powers—should danger approach, the Pokémob will simply teleport away.
entity.pokecube.kadabra.dexDesc: This Pokémob’s telekinesis is immensely powerful. To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up psychic energy in the star on its forehead.
entity.pokecube.alakazam.dexDesc: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.
entity.pokecube.alakazam-mega.dexDesc: Having traded away its muscles, Alakazam’s true power has been unleashed. With its psychic powers, it can foresee all things.
entity.pokecube.machop.dexDesc: Though as small as a child, it has strength enough to easily throw a well-built adult. Striving to become ever stronger, Machop trains by carrying a Graveler on its shoulders.
entity.pokecube.machoke.dexDesc: A sturdy creature boasting a robust physique and boundless stamina. Loves training above all else and voluntarily assists with tasks such as construction and clearing land.
entity.pokecube.machamp.dexDesc: In close combat, its four arms afford it offensive and defensive supremacy. In but a blink, this valiant Pokémob can overwhelm its foes with more than 1,000 blows from its fists.
entity.pokecube.machamp-gmax.dexDesc: The Gigantamax energy coursing through its arms makes its punches hit as hard as bomb blasts.
entity.pokecube.bellsprout.dexDesc: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
entity.pokecube.weepinbell.dexDesc: This Pokémob has the appearance of a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.
entity.pokecube.victreebel.dexDesc: In its mouth, it pools a fragrant nectar-like fluid. The fluid is really an acid that dissolves anything.
entity.pokecube.tentacool.dexDesc: They fire beams from the glassy, magenta orbs that resemble eyes atop their heads, and they drift in shallow seas. During low tide, they can sometimes be found on beaches, desiccated.
entity.pokecube.tentacruel.dexDesc: It has 80 tentacles, each with a venomous tip. These tentacles are also extendible, lengthening when Tentacruel attempts to catch prey. Use caution.
entity.pokecube.geodude.dexDesc: Makes its home in mountainous regions, using its arms to climb along harsh mountain roads. Carelessly kicking one will cause it to fly into a rage and chase after you.
entity.pokecube.geodude-alola.dexDesc: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches firmly to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.
entity.pokecube.graveler.dexDesc: Dwells in holes dug into sheer walls of stone. It enjoys rolling down slopes as though it were a boulder during a rockfall.
entity.pokecube.graveler-alola.dexDesc: Graveler’s entire body is tinged with electricity due to the stones it likes to eat. It’s very quick-tempered.
entity.pokecube.golem.dexDesc: The rocklike shell is shed each year. The cast-off shell then crumbles, reverting to a mass of soil, which can be spread across fields to promote crop growth.
entity.pokecube.golem-alola.dexDesc: It uses magnetism to accelerate and fire off rocks tinged with electricity. Even if it doesn’t score a direct hit, the jolt of electricity will do the job.
entity.pokecube.ponyta.dexDesc: These Pokémobs live in herds out in the grassland. Newborn foals lack their fiery manes, which will develop about an hour after birth.
entity.pokecube.ponyta-galar.dexDesc: This Pokémob will look into your eyes and read the contents of your heart. If it finds evil there, it promptly hides away.
entity.pokecube.rapidash.dexDesc: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.
entity.pokecube.rapidash-galar.dexDesc: Snaps at its foes with fangs cloaked in blazing flame. Despite its bulk, it deftly feints every which way, leading opponents on a deceptively merry chase as it all but dances around them.
entity.pokecube.slowpoke.dexDesc: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.
entity.pokecube.slowpoke-galar.dexDesc: Although this Pokémob is normally zoned out, its expression abruptly sharpens on occasion. The cause for this seems to lie in Slowpoke’s diet.
entity.pokecube.slowbro.dexDesc: Though usually dim-witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.
entity.pokecube.slowbro-galar.dexDesc: If this Pokémob squeezes the tongue of the Shellder biting it, the Shellder will launch a toxic liquid from the tip of its shell.
entity.pokecube.slowbro-mega.dexDesc: All the energy from Mega Evolution poured into the Shellder on its tail, leaving Slowpoke to be swallowed whole.
entity.pokecube.magnemite.dexDesc: It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it emits electromagnetic waves from the units on each side of its body.
entity.pokecube.magneton.dexDesc: A Magneton is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group of these Pokémobs can set off a magnetic storm.
entity.pokecube.farfetchd.dexDesc: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.
entity.pokecube.farfetchd-galar.dexDesc: The stalks of leeks are thicker and longer in the Galar region. Farfetch’d that adapted to these stalks took on a unique form.
entity.pokecube.doduo.dexDesc: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
entity.pokecube.dodrio.dexDesc: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. This Pokémob runs at nearly 40 mph.
entity.pokecube.seel.dexDesc: This Pokémob lives on icebergs. It uses the sharp point on its head to break up ice as it swims in the sea.
entity.pokecube.dewgong.dexDesc: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.
entity.pokecube.grimer.dexDesc: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.
entity.pokecube.grimer-alola.dexDesc: It has a passion for trash above all else, speedily digesting it and creating brilliant crystals of sparkling poison.
entity.pokecube.muk.dexDesc: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid kills plants and trees immediately upon contact.
entity.pokecube.muk-alola.dexDesc: The garbage it eats causes continuous chemical changes in its body, which produce its exceedingly vivid coloration.
entity.pokecube.shellder.dexDesc: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
entity.pokecube.cloyster.dexDesc: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.
entity.pokecube.gastly.dexDesc: Gaseous and completely impalpable. Also highly dangerous— inhaling part of its poisonous body will cause one to faint instantly.
entity.pokecube.haunter.dexDesc: This frightful, malevolent spirit can glide through walls, appearing wherever it likes. According to rumor, victims of a Haunter’s lick will wither to death day by day.
entity.pokecube.gengar.dexDesc: Possesses potential victims’ shadows in an effort to steal away the victims’ lives. If your shadow begins to laugh, you must take hold of a protective charm posthaste!
entity.pokecube.gengar-gmax.dexDesc: Rumor has it that its gigantic mouth leads not into its body, filled with cursed energy, but instead directly to the afterlife.
entity.pokecube.gengar-mega.dexDesc: Mega Evolution has made it possible for Gengar to access other dimensions. Its entire body is brimming with strange power.
entity.pokecube.onix.dexDesc: This chain of immense stones resembles a giant serpent. Tremors shake the earth above as it burrows deep beneath the ground, feeding on boulders as it goes.
entity.pokecube.drowzee.dexDesc: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
entity.pokecube.hypno.dexDesc: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
entity.pokecube.krabby.dexDesc: It lives in burrows dug on sandy beaches. Its pincers fully grow back if they are lost in battle.
entity.pokecube.kingler.dexDesc: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.
entity.pokecube.kingler-gmax.dexDesc: The flow of Gigantamax energy has spurred this Pokémob’s left pincer to grow to an enormous size. That claw can pulverize anything.
entity.pokecube.voltorb.dexDesc: It looks just like a Poké Cube. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.
entity.pokecube.voltorb-hisui.dexDesc: An enigmatic Pokémob that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Cube. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.
entity.pokecube.electrode.dexDesc: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.
entity.pokecube.electrode-hisui.dexDesc: The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokémob lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.
entity.pokecube.exeggcute.dexDesc: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
entity.pokecube.exeggutor.dexDesc: It is called the Walking Jungle. If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.
entity.pokecube.exeggutor-alola.dexDesc: As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, while within it awakened the power of the sleeping dragon.
entity.pokecube.cubone.dexDesc: When it thinks of its dead mother, it cries. Its crying makes the skull it wears rattle hollowly.
entity.pokecube.marowak.dexDesc: The bones it uses have been in its possession since it was born. It has a ferocious nature.
entity.pokecube.marowak-alola.dexDesc: The cursed flames that light up the bone carried by this Pokémob are said to cause both mental and physical pain that will never fade.
entity.pokecube.hitmonlee.dexDesc: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
entity.pokecube.hitmonchan.dexDesc: When Hitmonchan twists its arm while throwing a punch, the blow will pulverize even concrete. The Pokémob rests after three minutes of fighting.
entity.pokecube.lickitung.dexDesc: Wields its long tongue deftly, as though it were an arm. The Pokémob’s viscous saliva, once it has been collected and boiled down, yields a strong and highly useful adhesive.
entity.pokecube.koffing.dexDesc: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell; they are also explosive.
entity.pokecube.weezing.dexDesc: It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.
entity.pokecube.weezing-galar.dexDesc: This Pokémob consumes particles that contaminate the air. Instead of leaving droppings, it expels clean air.
entity.pokecube.rhyhorn.dexDesc: Its body is clad in a thick hide, and its tackles topple buildings. Unfortunately, it is not smart.
entity.pokecube.rhydon.dexDesc: Rapidly rotates its horn to bore through bedrock. It swaggers around volcanic regions, protected from the lava’s heat by its tough, armorlike hide.
entity.pokecube.chansey.dexDesc: This purehearted Pokémob shares its eggs with the injured. These eggs are so nutritious that they’ve been nicknamed “doctors’ doubles.”
entity.pokecube.tangela.dexDesc: It is cloaked entirely in blue vines, preventing any glimpse of its true identity. The vines impart a refreshing sensation when chewed—they’re useful as a spice.
entity.pokecube.kangaskhan.dexDesc: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets its baby out to play only when it feels safe to do so.
entity.pokecube.kangaskhan-mega.dexDesc: Its child has grown rapidly, thanks to the energy of Mega Evolution. Mother and child show their harmonious teamwork in battle.
entity.pokecube.horsea.dexDesc: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits black ink and flees.
entity.pokecube.seadra.dexDesc: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients.
entity.pokecube.goldeen.dexDesc: It swims at a steady five knots. If it senses danger, it will strike back with its sharp horn.
entity.pokecube.seaking.dexDesc: To protect its family, it will fight with its drill-sharp horn. It lives in hollowed rocks in streams.
entity.pokecube.staryu.dexDesc: If Staryu’s body is damaged, it will regenerate as long as the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
entity.pokecube.starmie.dexDesc: At the center of its body is a red core that sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
entity.pokecube.mr-mime.dexDesc: Emanations from its fingertips solidify the air into invisible walls that repel even harsh attacks.
entity.pokecube.mr-mime-galar.dexDesc: It can radiate chilliness from the bottoms of its feet. It’ll spend the whole day tap-dancing on a frozen floor.
entity.pokecube.scyther.dexDesc: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey’s attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokémob’s nimble motions.
entity.pokecube.jynx.dexDesc: Its cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.
entity.pokecube.electabuzz.dexDesc: Feeds on electrical energy. During sudden showers beneath looming thunderclouds, one can observe Electabuzz scaling tall trees, where the Pokémob will then wait for lightning to strike.
entity.pokecube.magmar.dexDesc: Legend has it that this Pokémob was born from the crater of a volcano. When wounded, it bathes in lava to heal its body, much as one would soak in a hot spring.
entity.pokecube.pinsir.dexDesc: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn apart. What it can’t tear, it tosses far away.
entity.pokecube.pinsir-mega.dexDesc: With its vaunted horns, it can lift an opponent 10 times heavier than itself and fly about with ease.
entity.pokecube.tauros.dexDesc: Once it takes aim at its prey, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.
entity.pokecube.magikarp.dexDesc: A feeble, pitiful imbecile of a Pokémob that is nonetheless very hardy. Unperturbed by turbid water, it can be found living in all sorts of places.
entity.pokecube.gyarados.dexDesc: Once Gyarados appears, its rage never settles until the Pokémob has razed the fields and mountains around it.
entity.pokecube.gyarados-mega.dexDesc: Although it obeys its instinctive drive to destroy everything within its reach, it will respond to orders from a Trainer it truly trusts.
entity.pokecube.lapras.dexDesc: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémobs on its back. It understands human speech.
entity.pokecube.lapras-gmax.dexDesc: Over 5,000 people can ride on its shell at once. And it’s a very comfortable ride, without the slightest shaking or swaying.
entity.pokecube.ditto.dexDesc: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
entity.pokecube.eevee.dexDesc: It is a rare Pokémob that adapts to harsh environments by changing its appearance and capabilities when it evolves.
entity.pokecube.eevee-gmax.dexDesc: Gigantamax energy upped the fluffiness of the fur around Eevee’s neck. The fur will envelop a foe, capturing its body and captivating its mind.
entity.pokecube.vaporeon.dexDesc: It has evolved to be suited for an aquatic life. It can become invisible when it melts away into water.
entity.pokecube.jolteon.dexDesc: It controls 10,000-volt power. When the fur covering its body stands on end, the fur is hard and sharp, like needles.
entity.pokecube.flareon.dexDesc: Flames burn within a saclike organ inside this Pokémob. When Flareon inhales, these flames grow in intensity, reaching a mighty 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
entity.pokecube.porygon.dexDesc: The world’s first artificially created Pokémob. It can travel through electronic space.
entity.pokecube.omanyte.dexDesc: It’s a Pokémob that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.
entity.pokecube.omastar.dexDesc: Weighed down by a large and heavy shell, Omastar couldn’t move very fast. Some say it went extinct because it was unable to catch food.
entity.pokecube.kabuto.dexDesc: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a sturdy shell.
entity.pokecube.kabutops.dexDesc: The cause behind the extinction of this species is unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémob that inhabited warm seas.
entity.pokecube.aerodactyl.dexDesc: It’s a Pokémob that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.
entity.pokecube.aerodactyl-mega.dexDesc: The power of Mega Evolution has completely restored its genes. The rocks on its body are harder than diamond.
entity.pokecube.snorlax.dexDesc: It stops eating only to sleep. It doesn’t feel full unless it eats nearly 900 pounds a day.
entity.pokecube.snorlax-gmax.dexDesc: Gigantamax energy has affected stray seeds and even pebbles that got stuck to Snorlax, making them grow to a huge size.
entity.pokecube.articuno.dexDesc: It’s said that this Pokémob’s beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.
entity.pokecube.articuno-galar.dexDesc: Its feather-like blades are composed of psychic energy and can shear through thick iron sheets as if they were paper.
entity.pokecube.zapdos.dexDesc: This Pokémob has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.
entity.pokecube.zapdos-galar.dexDesc: One kick from its powerful legs will pulverize a dump truck. Supposedly, this Pokémob runs through the mountains at over 180 mph.
entity.pokecube.moltres.dexDesc: It’s one of the legendary bird Pokémob. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.
entity.pokecube.moltres-galar.dexDesc: This Pokémob’s sinister, flame-like aura will consume the spirit of any creature it hits. Victims become burned-out shadows of themselves.
entity.pokecube.dratini.dexDesc: It is called the Mirage Pokémob because so few have seen it, but its shed skin has been found.
entity.pokecube.dragonair.dexDesc: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.
entity.pokecube.dragonite.dexDesc: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides wrecked ships to shore.
entity.pokecube.mewtwo.dexDesc: Mewtwo was created by recombining Mew’s genes. It’s said to have the most savage heart among Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.mewtwo-mega-x.dexDesc: Psychic power has augmented its muscles. It has a grip strength of one ton and can sprint a hundred meters in two seconds flat!
entity.pokecube.mewtwo-mega-y.dexDesc: Despite its diminished size, its mental power has grown phenomenally. With a mere thought, it can smash a skyscraper to smithereens.
entity.pokecube.mew.dexDesc: It’s very intelligent and can use an incredible variety of moves. Many believe that all other Pokémob are descendants of this one.
entity.pokecube.chikorita.dexDesc: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the air’s temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.
entity.pokecube.bayleef.dexDesc: The buds that ring its neck give off a spicy aroma that perks people up.
entity.pokecube.meganium.dexDesc: The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémob gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.
entity.pokecube.cyndaquil.dexDesc: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémob is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
entity.pokecube.quilava.dexDesc: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémob applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.
entity.pokecube.typhlosion.dexDesc: Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokémob creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.
entity.pokecube.typhlosion-hisui.dexDesc: Said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife. Its form has been influenced by the energy of the sacred mountain towering at Hisui’s center.
entity.pokecube.totodile.dexDesc: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémob may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.
entity.pokecube.croconaw.dexDesc: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.
entity.pokecube.feraligatr.dexDesc: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.
entity.pokecube.sentret.dexDesc: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémob becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
entity.pokecube.furret.dexDesc: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémob is very nimble and fleet.
entity.pokecube.hoothoot.dexDesc: Hoothoot has an internal organ that senses and tracks the earth’s rotation. Using this special organ, this Pokémob begins hooting at precisely the same time every day.
entity.pokecube.noctowl.dexDesc: Noctowl never fails at catching prey in darkness. This Pokémob owes its success to its superior vision that allows it to see in minimal light, and to its soft, supple wings that make no sound in flight.
entity.pokecube.ledyba.dexDesc: Ledyba secretes an aromatic fluid from where its legs join its body. This fluid is used for communicating with others. This Pokémob conveys its feelings to others by altering the fluid’s scent.
entity.pokecube.ledian.dexDesc: In battle, it throws punches with all four arms. The power of each individual blow is piddly, so it aims to win by quantity rather than quality.
entity.pokecube.spinarak.dexDesc: The web spun by Spinarak can be considered its second nervous system. It is said that this Pokémob can determine what kind of prey is touching its web just by the tiny vibrations it feels through the web’s strands.
entity.pokecube.ariados.dexDesc: It attaches silk to its prey and sets it free. Later, it tracks the silk to the prey and its friends.
entity.pokecube.crobat.dexDesc: Its hind limbs have become another set of wings. Crobat expertly maneuvers its four wings to dart in exquisite fashion through even the most confined caves without losing any speed.
entity.pokecube.chinchou.dexDesc: Chinchou’s two antennas are filled with cells that generate strong electricity. This Pokémob’s cells create so much electrical power, it even makes itself tingle slightly.
entity.pokecube.lanturn.dexDesc: Lanturn is nicknamed “the deep-sea star” for its illuminated antenna. This Pokémob produces light by causing a chemical reaction between bacteria and its bodily fluids inside the antenna.
entity.pokecube.pichu.dexDesc: Pichu stores electricity in the sacs on its cheeks but discharges it inadvertently when agitated or excited. Being yet immature, the Pokémob’s handling of electricity is rather inept.
entity.pokecube.cleffa.dexDesc: In silhouette, they resemble twinkling starlight. When shooting stars rain from the night sky, Cleffa gather in numbers and dance as though they are indeed incarnations of the stars.
entity.pokecube.igglybuff.dexDesc: Igglybuff has a soft and plushy body that feels very much like a marshmallow. From this body wafts a gently sweet fragrance that soothes and calms the emotions of its foes.
entity.pokecube.togepi.dexDesc: As its energy, Togepi uses the positive emotions of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and Pokémob. This Pokémob stores up feelings of happiness inside its shell, then shares them with others.
entity.pokecube.togetic.dexDesc: No records exist of Togetic being seen in the wilds. Rumors abound that it evolves under the loving care of a trusted human companion, upon whom the Pokémob then bestows great joy.
entity.pokecube.natu.dexDesc: Natu cannot fly because its wings are not yet fully grown. If your eyes meet with this Pokémob’s eyes, it will stare back intently at you. But if you move even slightly, it will hop away to safety.
entity.pokecube.xatu.dexDesc: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.
entity.pokecube.mareep.dexDesc: Mareep’s fluffy coat of wool rubs together and builds a static charge. The more static electricity is charged, the more brightly the lightbulb at the tip of its tail glows.
entity.pokecube.flaaffy.dexDesc: In the places on its body where fleece doesn’t grow, its skin is rubbery and doesn’t conduct electricity. Those spots are safe to touch.
entity.pokecube.ampharos.dexDesc: Ampharos gives off so much light that it can be seen even from space. People in the old days used the light of this Pokémob to send signals back and forth with others far away.
entity.pokecube.ampharos-mega.dexDesc: Excess energy from Mega Evolution stimulates its genes, and the wool it had lost grows in again.
entity.pokecube.bellossom.dexDesc: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.
entity.pokecube.marill.dexDesc: This Pokémob uses its round tail as a float. The ball of Marill’s tail is filled with nutrients that have been turned into an oil.
entity.pokecube.azumarill.dexDesc: Azumarill’s long ears are indispensable sensors. By focusing its hearing, this Pokémob can identify what kinds of prey are around, even in rough and fast-running rivers.
entity.pokecube.sudowoodo.dexDesc: Though it pretends to be a tree, it fails to fool even children. To the touch, its body feels more like rock than tree bark.
entity.pokecube.politoed.dexDesc: The curled hair on Politoed’s head is proof of its status as a king. It is said that the longer and more curled the hair, the more respect this Pokémob earns from its peers.
entity.pokecube.hoppip.dexDesc: This Pokémob drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.
entity.pokecube.skiploom.dexDesc: It blooms when the weather warms. It floats in the sky to soak up as much sunlight as possible.
entity.pokecube.jumpluff.dexDesc: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémob descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
entity.pokecube.aipom.dexDesc: It uses its tail to pluck fruits that are out of reach. Its tail is more adept than its real hands.
entity.pokecube.sunkern.dexDesc: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.
entity.pokecube.sunflora.dexDesc: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.
entity.pokecube.yanma.dexDesc: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémob uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.
entity.pokecube.wooper.dexDesc: Wooper usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes out onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with a gooey, toxic film.
entity.pokecube.quagsire.dexDesc: Quagsire hunts for food by leaving its mouth wide open in water and waiting for its prey to blunder in unaware. Because the Pokémob does not move, it does not get very hungry.
entity.pokecube.espeon.dexDesc: Wields an arcane power with which it can predict the weather and even people’s thoughts. When bathed in sunshine, the scarlet orb on its brow glows and builds energy.
entity.pokecube.umbreon.dexDesc: It is most active in the wee hours of the night, when moonlight bathes the land. Its large eyes can pierce the darkness and perceive prey with absolute clarity.
entity.pokecube.murkrow.dexDesc: Murkrow was feared and loathed as the alleged bearer of ill fortune. This Pokémob shows strong interest in anything that sparkles or glitters. It will even try to steal rings from women.
entity.pokecube.slowking.dexDesc: Slowking undertakes research every day in an effort to solve the mysteries of the world. However, this Pokémob apparently forgets everything it has learned if the Shellder on its head comes off.
entity.pokecube.slowking-galar.dexDesc: A combination of toxins and the shock of evolving has increased Shellder’s intelligence to the point that Shellder now controls Slowking.
entity.pokecube.misdreavus.dexDesc: Misdreavus frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. The Pokémob apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fearful feelings of foes and turn them into nutrition.
entity.pokecube.unown.dexDesc: This Pokémob is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown.
entity.pokecube.wobbuffet.dexDesc: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
entity.pokecube.girafarig.dexDesc: Girafarig’s rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn’t need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.
entity.pokecube.pineco.dexDesc: PiIt looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokémob that peck it by mistake.neco
entity.pokecube.forretress.dexDesc: When something approaches it, it fires off fragments of its steel shell in attack. This is not a conscious action but a conditioned reflex.
entity.pokecube.dunsparce.dexDesc: Dunsparce has a drill for its tail. It uses this tail to burrow into the ground backward. This Pokémob is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.
entity.pokecube.gligar.dexDesc: Its tail is tipped by a thick, horrible stinger. To bring down prey, it will first obscure their vision by covering their faces with its body, and then it will use the stinger to inject them with venom.
entity.pokecube.steelix.dexDesc: This Pokémob evolved through use of a strange item. Its body is coated with steel powder and notably hard—not even diamond can leave so much as a scratch.
entity.pokecube.steelix-mega.dexDesc: Steelix lives even further underground than Onix. This Pokémob is known to dig toward the earth’s core. There are records of this Pokémob reaching a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.
entity.pokecube.snubbull.dexDesc: In contrast to its appearance, it’s quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémob, it sometimes gets bullied.
entity.pokecube.granbull.dexDesc: Granbull has a particularly well-developed lower jaw. The enormous fangs are heavy, causing the Pokémob to tip its head back for balance. Unless it is startled, it will not try to bite indiscriminately.
entity.pokecube.qwilfish.dexDesc: Qwilfish sucks in water, inflating itself. This Pokémob uses the pressure of the water it swallowed to shoot toxic quills all at once from all over its body. It finds swimming somewhat challenging.
entity.pokecube.qwilfish-hisui.dexDesc: Fishers detest this troublesome Pokémob because it sprays poison from its spines, getting it everywhere. A different form of Qwilfish lives in other regions.
entity.pokecube.scizor.dexDesc: Scizor has a body with the hardness of steel. It is not easily fazed by ordinary sorts of attacks. This Pokémob flaps its wings to regulate its body temperature.
entity.pokecube.scizor-mega.dexDesc: The excess energy that bathes this Pokémob keeps it in constant danger of overflow. It can’t sustain a battle over long periods of time.
entity.pokecube.shuckle.dexDesc: Shuckle quietly hides itself under rocks, keeping its body concealed inside its hard shell while eating berries it has stored away. The berries mix with its body fluids to become a juice.
entity.pokecube.heracross.dexDesc: This Pokémob takes pride in its strength, which allows it to lift things 100 times heavier than itself with no trouble at all.
entity.pokecube.heracross-mega.dexDesc: A tremendous influx of energy builds it up, but when Mega Evolution ends, Heracross is bothered by terrible soreness in its muscles.
entity.pokecube.sneasel.dexDesc: Sneasel scales trees by punching its hooked claws into the bark. This Pokémob seeks out unguarded nests and steals eggs for food while the parents are away.
entity.pokecube.sneasel-hisui.dexDesc: Its sturdy, curved claws are ideal for traversing precipitous cliffs. From the tips of these claws drips a venom that infiltrates the nerves of any prey caught in Sneasel’s grasp.
entity.pokecube.teddiursa.dexDesc: This Pokémob likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.
entity.pokecube.ursaring.dexDesc: In the forests inhabited by Ursaring, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This Pokémob walks through its forest gathering food every day.
entity.pokecube.slugma.dexDesc: Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokémob’s body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.
entity.pokecube.magcargo.dexDesc: Its body temperature is roughly 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Flames burst from gaps in its shell made of hardened magma.
entity.pokecube.swinub.dexDesc: Swinub roots for food by rubbing its snout against the ground. Its favorite food is a mushroom that grows under the cover of dead grass. This Pokémob occasionally roots out hot springs.
entity.pokecube.piloswine.dexDesc: Piloswine is covered by a thick coat of long hair that enables it to endure the freezing cold. This Pokémob uses its tusks to dig up food that has been buried under ice.
entity.pokecube.corsola.dexDesc: It will regrow any branches that break off its head. People keep particularly beautiful Corsola branches as charms to promote safe childbirth.
entity.pokecube.corsola-galar.dexDesc: Sudden climate change wiped out this ancient kind of Corsola. This Pokémob absorbs others’ life-force through its branches.
entity.pokecube.remoraid.dexDesc: Spits water from its mouth with incredible accuracy. It captures Burmy by shooting them down off the branches from which they dangle.
entity.pokecube.octillery.dexDesc: The ink it spits when escaping is special. It contains a substance that dulls the sense of smell, so Pokémob with keen noses get lost.
entity.pokecube.delibird.dexDesc: It shares its food with people who are stranded. Because Delibird is omnivorous, sometimes it gives those people bug Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.mantine.dexDesc: It swims elegantly, mindless of Remoraid hitching onto its broad fins. It is naturally docile.
entity.pokecube.skarmory.dexDesc: Skarmory is entirely encased in hard, protective armor. This Pokémob flies at close to 190 mph. It slashes foes with its wings that possess swordlike cutting edges.
entity.pokecube.houndour.dexDesc: It cooperates with others skillfully. When it becomes your partner, it’s very loyal to you as its Trainer and will obey your orders.
entity.pokecube.houndoom.dexDesc: They spew flames mixed with poison to finish off their opponents. They divvy up their prey evenly among the members of their pack.
entity.pokecube.houndoom-mega.dexDesc: Houndoom’s entire body generates heat when it Mega Evolves. Its fearsome fiery breath turns its opponents to ash.
entity.pokecube.kingdra.dexDesc: Kingdra lives at extreme ocean depths that are otherwise uninhabited. It has long been believed that the yawning of this Pokémob creates spiraling ocean currents.
entity.pokecube.phanpy.dexDesc: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.
entity.pokecube.donphan.dexDesc: It attacks by curling up and rolling into its foe. It can blow apart a house in one hit.
entity.pokecube.porygon2.dexDesc: A bizarre item caused this Pokémob to evolve. While it now exhibits many new gestures and expressions, its biology remains inscrutable.
entity.pokecube.stantler.dexDesc: Its strangely shaped antlers have the power to bewitch those who see them. Medicine made by grinding up the black orbs from fallen antlers is an effective treatment for insomnia.
entity.pokecube.smeargle.dexDesc: The unique creations produced by each Smeargle are painted using the fluid that oozes from its tail. This is how it marks its territory.
entity.pokecube.tyrogue.dexDesc: It is famous for its eagerness to fight and always nurses injuries from challenging larger foes.
entity.pokecube.hitmontop.dexDesc: Hitmontop spins on its head at high speed, all the while delivering kicks. This technique is a remarkable mix of both offense and defense at the same time. The Pokémob travels faster spinning than it does walking.
entity.pokecube.smoochum.dexDesc: Smoochum actively runs about, but also falls quite often. Whenever the chance arrives, it will look for its reflection to make sure its face hasn’t become dirty.
entity.pokecube.elekid.dexDesc: It’s not good at storing electricity yet. This Pokémob sneaks into people’s homes, looking for electrical outlets to eat electricity from.
entity.pokecube.magby.dexDesc: This Pokémob makes its home near volcanoes. At the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma, resting and recovering from the day’s fatigue.
entity.pokecube.miltank.dexDesc: This Pokémob needs to be milked every day, or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk changes with the seasons.
entity.pokecube.blissey.dexDesc: A kindhearted Pokémob that will care for any sick person or Pokémob until their health improves. The eggs it lays are delicious and bring good fortune to those who eat them.
entity.pokecube.raikou.dexDesc: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémob send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.
entity.pokecube.entei.dexDesc: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémob is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.
entity.pokecube.suicune.dexDesc: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémob has the power to purify dirty water.
entity.pokecube.larvitar.dexDesc: Larvitar is born deep under the ground. To come up to the surface, this Pokémob must eat its way through the soil above. Until it does so, Larvitar cannot see its parents.
entity.pokecube.pupitar.dexDesc: Pupitar creates a gas inside its body that it compresses and forcefully ejects to propel itself like a jet. The body is very durable—it avoids damage even if it hits solid steel.
entity.pokecube.tyranitar.dexDesc: Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a whole mountain to make its nest. This Pokémob wanders about in mountains seeking new opponents to fight.
entity.pokecube.tyranitar-mega.dexDesc: Due to the colossal power poured into it, this Pokémob’s back split right open. Its destructive instincts are the only thing keeping it moving.
entity.pokecube.lugia.dexDesc: Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémob chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.
entity.pokecube.ho-oh.dexDesc: Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémob is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.
entity.pokecube.celebi.dexDesc: This Pokémob came from the future by crossing over time. It is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.
entity.pokecube.treecko.dexDesc: Treecko has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable it to scale vertical walls. This Pokémob attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.
entity.pokecube.grovyle.dexDesc: The leaves growing out of Grovyle’s body are convenient for camouflaging it from enemies in the forest. This Pokémob is a master at climbing trees in jungles.
entity.pokecube.sceptile.dexDesc: The leaves growing on Sceptile’s body are very sharp edged. This Pokémob is very agile—it leaps all over the branches of trees and jumps on its foe from above or behind.
entity.pokecube.sceptile-mega.dexDesc: The leaves that grow on its arms can slice down thick trees. It is without peer in jungle combat.
entity.pokecube.torchic.dexDesc: Torchic sticks with its Trainer, following behind with unsteady steps. This Pokémob breathes fire of over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit, including fireballs that leave the foe scorched black.
entity.pokecube.combusken.dexDesc: Combusken battles with the intensely hot flames it spews from its beak and with outstandingly destructive kicks. This Pokémob’s cry is very loud and distracting.
entity.pokecube.blaziken.dexDesc: In battle, Blaziken blows out intense flames from its wrists and attacks foes courageously. The stronger the foe, the more intensely this Pokémob’s wrists burn.
entity.pokecube.blaziken-mega.dexDesc: Flames spout from its wrists, enveloping its knuckles. Its punches scorch its foes.
entity.pokecube.mudkip.dexDesc: Using the fin on its head, Mudkip senses the flow of water to keep track of what’s going on around it. Mudkip has the strength to heft boulders.
entity.pokecube.marshtomp.dexDesc: The surface of Marshtomp’s body is enveloped by a thin, sticky film that enables it to live on land. This Pokémob plays in mud on beaches when the ocean tide is low.
entity.pokecube.swampert.dexDesc: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.
entity.pokecube.swampert-mega.dexDesc: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.
entity.pokecube.poochyena.dexDesc: A Pokémob with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.
entity.pokecube.mightyena.dexDesc: Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory of its life in the wild compels the Pokémob to obey only those Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.
entity.pokecube.zigzagoon.dexDesc: The hair on Zigzagoon’s back is bristly. It rubs the hard back hair against trees to leave its territorial markings. This Pokémob may play dead to fool foes in battle.
entity.pokecube.zigzagoon-galar.dexDesc: Thought to be the oldest form of Zigzagoon, it moves in zigzags and wreaks havoc upon its surroundings.
entity.pokecube.linoone.dexDesc: When hunting, Linoone will make a beeline straight for the prey at a full run. While this Pokémob is capable of topping 60 mph, it has to come to a screeching halt before it can turn.
entity.pokecube.linoone-galar.dexDesc: It uses its long tongue to taunt opponents. Once the opposition is enraged, this Pokémob hurls itself at the opponent, tackling them forcefully.
entity.pokecube.wurmple.dexDesc: It spits a white silk thread that turns sticky when coming into contact with air. The silk is used to immobilize foes.
entity.pokecube.silcoon.dexDesc: Wraps itself in thin strings of silk while it stores energy for evolution. It can’t extend its limbs and its movement is slow, but its eyes keep a sharp lookout—Silcoon is always on guard.
entity.pokecube.beautifly.dexDesc: A colorful and incredibly beautiful but also greedy Pokémob. In an effort to keep its favorite food all to itself, it will chase away Combee as they try to gather nectar.
entity.pokecube.cascoon.dexDesc: The silk coating its body is thin but sufficiently strong. Cascoon’s silk has a luster and texture superior to that of Silcoon’s, and clothes made using Cascoon silk are regarded as top-notch.
entity.pokecube.dustox.dexDesc: It violently flutters its wings to scatter toxic dust when attacked. It becomes active after sunset.
entity.pokecube.lotad.dexDesc: Lotad is said to have dwelled on land before. However, this Pokémob is thought to have returned to water because the leaf on its head grew large and heavy. It now lives by floating atop the water.
entity.pokecube.lombre.dexDesc: Lombre’s entire body is covered by a slippery, slimy film. It feels horribly unpleasant to be touched by this Pokémob’s hands. Lombre is often mistaken for a human child.
entity.pokecube.ludicolo.dexDesc: Ludicolo begins dancing as soon as it hears cheerful, festive music. This Pokémob is said to appear when it hears the singing of children on hiking outings.
entity.pokecube.seedot.dexDesc: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémob that try to peck at it.
entity.pokecube.nuzleaf.dexDesc: Nuzleaf live in densely overgrown forests. They occasionally venture out of the forest to startle people. This Pokémob dislikes having its long nose pinched.
entity.pokecube.shiftry.dexDesc: Shiftry is a mysterious Pokémob that is said to live atop towering trees dating back over a thousand years. It creates terrific windstorms with the fans it holds.
entity.pokecube.taillow.dexDesc: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémob feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.
entity.pokecube.swellow.dexDesc: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other’s wings.
entity.pokecube.wingull.dexDesc: Catching sea winds with its long wings, it soars as if it were a glider. It folds its wings to rest.
entity.pokecube.pelipper.dexDesc: It acts as a delivery service by carrying small Pokémob in its bill. It bobs on the waves to rest.
entity.pokecube.ralts.dexDesc: It uses the horns on its head to sense human emotions. It is said to appear in front of cheerful people.
entity.pokecube.kirlia.dexDesc: It is highly perceptive of its Trainer’s feelings. It dances when it is feeling happy.
entity.pokecube.gardevoir.dexDesc: It will try to guard its trusted Trainer with its life. It has the ability to see the future.
entity.pokecube.gardevoir-mega.dexDesc: It will dedicate itself to defending a master it has come to adore. Its pure white dress, reminiscent of those worn by ladies of nobility, is the dress of one who is willing to risk their life.
entity.pokecube.surskit.dexDesc: It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey in with a sweet scent released from the tip of its head.
entity.pokecube.masquerain.dexDesc: Its antennae have eye patterns on them. Its four wings enable it to hover and fly in any direction.
entity.pokecube.shroomish.dexDesc: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over the body if inhaled.
entity.pokecube.breloom.dexDesc: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.
entity.pokecube.slakoth.dexDesc: It spends nearly all its time in a day sprawled out. Just seeing it makes one drowsy.
entity.pokecube.vigoroth.dexDesc: Its heart beats at 10 times its previous rate, so it cannot sit still for even a moment.
entity.pokecube.slaking.dexDesc: It is the world’s laziest Pokémob. When it is lounging, it is actually saving energy for striking back.
entity.pokecube.nincada.dexDesc: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.
entity.pokecube.ninjask.dexDesc: Because they move so quickly, they sometimes become unseeable. They congregate around tree sap.
entity.pokecube.shedinja.dexDesc: It is a discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one’s spirit.
entity.pokecube.whismur.dexDesc: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.
entity.pokecube.loudred.dexDesc: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.
entity.pokecube.exploud.dexDesc: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.
entity.pokecube.makuhita.dexDesc: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.
entity.pokecube.hariyama.dexDesc: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémob. It can send a truck flying with its arm thrusts.
entity.pokecube.azurill.dexDesc: Its tail is filled with nutrients necessary for growth. It plays by bouncing on its tail.
entity.pokecube.nosepass.dexDesc: Its nose is a magnet. As a result, this Pokémob always keeps its face pointing north.
entity.pokecube.skitty.dexDesc: It can’t stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in circles, chasing its own tail.
entity.pokecube.delcatty.dexDesc: Delcatty sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent nest. If other Pokémob approach it as it sleeps, this Pokémob will never fight—it will just move away somewhere else.
entity.pokecube.sableye.dexDesc: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.
entity.pokecube.sableye-mega.dexDesc: The jewel from its chest, which has grown gigantic due to the effects of Mega Evolution, can turn back any attack.
entity.pokecube.mawile.dexDesc: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.
entity.pokecube.mawile-mega.dexDesc: Its two sets of jaws thrash about violently as if they each had a will of their own. One gnash from them can turn a boulder to dust.
entity.pokecube.aron.dexDesc: It usually lives deep in mountains. But when it’s hungry, it shows up at the foot of the mountains and eats railroad tracks and cars.
entity.pokecube.lairon.dexDesc: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes its steely body against others to fight over territory.
entity.pokecube.aggron.dexDesc: Aggron claims an entire mountain as its own territory. It mercilessly beats up anything that violates its environment. This Pokémob vigilantly patrols its territory at all times.
entity.pokecube.aggron-mega.dexDesc: Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by ramming into them horn first.
entity.pokecube.meditite.dexDesc: Meditite undertakes rigorous mental training deep in the mountains. However, whenever it meditates, this Pokémob always loses its concentration and focus. As a result, its training never ends.
entity.pokecube.medicham.dexDesc: It elegantly avoids attacks with dance-like steps, then launches a devastating blow in the same motion.
entity.pokecube.medicham-mega.dexDesc: It is said that through meditation, Medicham heightens energy inside its body and sharpens its sixth sense. This Pokémob hides its presence by merging itself with fields and mountains.
entity.pokecube.electrike.dexDesc: It stores electricity in its fur. It gives off sparks from all over its body in seasons when the air is dry.
entity.pokecube.manectric.dexDesc: It discharges electricity from its mane. The Pokémob creates a thundercloud overhead from which to drop lightning bolts.
entity.pokecube.manectric-mega.dexDesc: Mega Evolution fills its body with a tremendous amount of electricity, but it’s too much for Manectric to fully control.
entity.pokecube.plusle.dexDesc: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémob cries loudly.
entity.pokecube.minun.dexDesc: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémob gives off increasing amounts of sparks.
entity.pokecube.volbeat.dexDesc: Volbeat’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémob loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.
entity.pokecube.illumise.dexDesc: Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. This Pokémob is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.
entity.pokecube.roselia.dexDesc: Roselia shoots sharp thorns as projectiles at any opponent that tries to steal the flowers on its arms. The aroma of this Pokémob brings serenity to living things.
entity.pokecube.gulpin.dexDesc: Almost all its body is its stomach. Its harsh digestive juices quickly dissolve anything it swallows.
entity.pokecube.swalot.dexDesc: It swallows anything whole. It sweats toxic fluids from its follicles to douse foes.
entity.pokecube.carvanha.dexDesc: With its sturdy jaws and fangs, it can easily chomp wooden boats to splinters. It fights with Basculin over food.
entity.pokecube.sharpedo.dexDesc: Nicknamed “the bully of the sea,” Sharpedo is widely feared. Its cruel fangs grow back immediately if they snap off. Just one of these Pokémobs can thoroughly tear apart a supertanker.
entity.pokecube.sharpedo-mega.dexDesc: The yellow patterns it bears are old scars. The energy from Mega Evolution runs through them, causing it sharp pain and suffering.
entity.pokecube.wailmer.dexDesc: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.
entity.pokecube.wailord.dexDesc: It’s the biggest of all Pokémob. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.
entity.pokecube.numel.dexDesc: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing Numel down.
entity.pokecube.camerupt.dexDesc: The humps on Camerupt’s back are formed by a transformation of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma. This Pokémob apparently erupts often when it is enraged.
entity.pokecube.camerupt-mega.dexDesc: Camerupt has a volcano inside its body. Magma of 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. Occasionally, the humps on this Pokémob’s back erupt, spewing the superheated magma.
entity.pokecube.torkoal.dexDesc: Torkoal generates energy by burning coal. It grows weaker as the fire dies down. When it is preparing for battle, this Pokémob burns more coal.
entity.pokecube.spoink.dexDesc: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.
entity.pokecube.grumpig.dexDesc: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to amplify its psychic power waves for gaining total control over its foe. When this Pokémob uses its special power, its snorting breath grows labored.
entity.pokecube.spinda.dexDesc: No two Spinda are said to have identical spot patterns on their hides. This Pokémob moves in a curious manner as if it is stumbling in dizziness. Its lurching movements can cause the opponent to become confused.
entity.pokecube.trapinch.dexDesc: It builds nests that double as traps, lying in wait for its prey to get caught. When night falls, it digs itself a spot beneath the sand to sleep.
entity.pokecube.vibrava.dexDesc: Vibrava’s wings have not yet completed the process of growing. Rather than flying long distances, they are more useful for generating ultrasonic waves by vibrating.
entity.pokecube.flygon.dexDesc: Flygon is nicknamed “the elemental spirit of the desert.” Because its flapping wings whip up a cloud of sand, this Pokémob is always enveloped in a sandstorm while flying.
entity.pokecube.cacnea.dexDesc: Cacnea lives in arid locations such as deserts. It releases a strong aroma from its flower to attract prey. When prey comes near, this Pokémob shoots sharp thorns from its body to bring the victim down.
entity.pokecube.cacturne.dexDesc: During the daytime, Cacturne remains unmoving so that it does not lose any moisture to the harsh desert sun. This Pokémob becomes active at night when the temperature drops.
entity.pokecube.swablu.dexDesc: Its cottony wings are full of air, making them light and fluffy to the touch. Swablu takes diligent care of its wings.
entity.pokecube.altaria.dexDesc: This Pokémob has a kind disposition, but if it’s provoked, it will threaten opponents with shrill cries before attacking them without mercy.
entity.pokecube.altaria-mega.dexDesc: It looks like a fluffy cloud when it is in flight. It hums with its soprano voice.
entity.pokecube.zangoose.dexDesc: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémob shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.
entity.pokecube.seviper.dexDesc: Seviper’s swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémob will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.
entity.pokecube.lunatone.dexDesc: Lunatone becomes active around the time of the full moon. Instead of walking, it moves by floating in midair. The Pokémob’s intimidating red eyes cause all those who see it to become transfixed with fear.
entity.pokecube.solrock.dexDesc: Sunlight is the source of Solrock’s power. It is said to possess the ability to read the emotions of others. This Pokémob gives off intense heat while rotating its body.
entity.pokecube.barboach.dexDesc: Barboach’s body is covered with a slimy film. If a foe grabs it, this Pokémob just slips out of the enemy’s grip. This Pokémob grows weak if the slimy coating dries up.
entity.pokecube.whiscash.dexDesc: A glutton that devours anything that moves, it quietly lurks at the bottom of swamps, lying in wait for prey.
entity.pokecube.corphish.dexDesc: Corphish catches prey with its sharp claws. It has no likes or dislikes when it comes to food—it will eat anything. This Pokémob has no trouble living in filthy water.
entity.pokecube.crawdaunt.dexDesc: Crawdaunt has an extremely violent nature that compels it to challenge other living things to battle. Other life-forms refuse to live in ponds inhabited by this Pokémob, making them desolate places.
entity.pokecube.baltoy.dexDesc: As soon as it spots others of its kind, Baltoy congregates with them and then begins crying noisily in unison. This Pokémob sleeps while cleverly balancing itself on its one foot.
entity.pokecube.claydol.dexDesc: Claydol are said to be dolls of mud made by primitive humans and brought to life by exposure to a mysterious ray. This Pokémob moves about while levitating.
entity.pokecube.lileep.dexDesc: Lileep is an ancient Pokémob that was regenerated from a fossil. It remains permanently anchored to a rock. From its immobile perch, this Pokémob intently scans for prey with its two eyes.
entity.pokecube.cradily.dexDesc: Cradily roams around the ocean floor in search of food. This Pokémob freely extends its tree trunk-like neck and captures unwary prey using its eight tentacles.
entity.pokecube.anorith.dexDesc: Anorith was regenerated from a prehistoric fossil. This primitive Pokémob once lived in warm seas. It grips its prey firmly between its two large claws.
entity.pokecube.armaldo.dexDesc: Armaldo’s tough armor makes all attacks bounce off. This Pokémob’s two enormous claws can be freely extended or contracted. They have the power to punch right through a steel slab.
entity.pokecube.feebas.dexDesc: A tough Pokémob that is perfectly fine even in dirty water. However, due to its ragged, shabby appearance, it isn’t popular.
entity.pokecube.milotic.dexDesc: Milotic is said to be the most beautiful of all the Pokémob. It has the power to becalm such emotions as anger and hostility to quell bitter feuding.
entity.pokecube.castform.dexDesc: Castform’s appearance changes with the weather. This Pokémob gained the ability to use the vast power of nature to protect its tiny body.
entity.pokecube.castform-rainy.dexDesc: Castform borrows the power of nature to transform itself into the guises of the sun, rain, and snow-clouds. This Pokémob’s feelings change with the weather.
entity.pokecube.castform-snowy.dexDesc: It changes its form depending on the weather. Changes in the temperature or humidity appear to affect its cellular structure.
entity.pokecube.castform-sunny.dexDesc: Its form changes on its own, due to its cells’ sensitive reactions to temperature and humidity.
entity.pokecube.kecleon.dexDesc: Kecleon is capable of changing its body colors at will to blend in with its surroundings. There is one exception—this Pokémob can’t change the zigzag pattern on its belly.
entity.pokecube.shuppet.dexDesc: Shuppet grows by feeding on dark emotions, such as vengefulness and envy, in the hearts of people. It roams through cities in search of grudges that taint people.
entity.pokecube.banette.dexDesc: Banette generates energy for laying strong curses by sticking pins into its own body. This Pokémob was originally a pitiful plush doll that was thrown away.
entity.pokecube.banette-mega.dexDesc: Banette generates energy for laying strong curses by sticking pins into its own body. This Pokémob was originally a pitiful plush doll that was thrown away.
entity.pokecube.duskull.dexDesc: Duskull can pass through any wall no matter how thick it may be. Once this Pokémob chooses a target, it will doggedly pursue the intended victim until the break of dawn.
entity.pokecube.dusclops.dexDesc: Dusclops’s body is completely hollow—there is nothing at all inside. It is said that its body is like a black hole. This Pokémob will absorb anything into its body, but nothing will ever come back out.
entity.pokecube.tropius.dexDesc: The bunches of fruit around Tropius’s neck are very popular with children. This Pokémob loves fruit, and eats it continuously. Apparently, its love for fruit resulted in its own outgrowth of fruit.
entity.pokecube.chimecho.dexDesc: Chimecho makes its cries echo inside its hollow body. When this Pokémob becomes enraged, its cries result in ultrasonic waves that have the power to knock foes flying.
entity.pokecube.absol.dexDesc: Absol has the ability to foretell the coming of natural disasters. It lives in a harsh, rugged mountain environment. This Pokémob very rarely ventures down from the mountains.
entity.pokecube.absol-mega.dexDesc: It converts the energy from Mega Evolution into an intimidating aura. Fainthearted people expire from shock at the sight of it.
entity.pokecube.wynaut.dexDesc: Wynaut can always be seen with a big, happy smile on its face. Look at its tail to determine if it is angry. When angered, this Pokémob will be slapping the ground with its tail.
entity.pokecube.snorunt.dexDesc: It can only survive in cold areas. It bounces happily around, even in environments as cold as -150 degrees Fahrenheit.
entity.pokecube.glalie.dexDesc: Glalie has a body made of rock, which it hardens with an armor of ice. This Pokémob has the ability to freeze moisture in the atmosphere into any shape it desires.
entity.pokecube.glalie-mega.dexDesc: The excess energy from Mega Evolution spilled over from its mouth, breaking its jaw. It spews endless blizzards.
entity.pokecube.spheal.dexDesc: This Pokémob’s body is covered in blubber and impressively round. It’s faster for Spheal to roll around than walk.
entity.pokecube.sealeo.dexDesc: Sealeo has the habit of always juggling on the tip of its nose anything it sees for the first time. This Pokémob occasionally entertains itself by balancing and rolling a Spheal on its nose.
entity.pokecube.walrein.dexDesc: Walrein’s two massively developed tusks can totally shatter blocks of ice weighing 10 tons with one blow. This Pokémob’s thick coat of blubber insulates it from subzero temperatures.
entity.pokecube.clamperl.dexDesc: Despite its appearance, it’s carnivorous. It clamps down on its prey with both sides of its shell and doesn’t let go until they stop moving.
entity.pokecube.huntail.dexDesc: Huntail’s tail is shaped like a fish. It uses the tail to attract prey, then swallows the prey whole with its large, gaping mouth. This Pokémob swims by wiggling its slender body like a snake.
entity.pokecube.gorebyss.dexDesc: Although Gorebyss is the very picture of elegance and beauty while swimming, it is also cruel. When it spots prey, this Pokémob inserts its thin mouth into the prey’s body and drains the prey of its body fluids.
entity.pokecube.relicanth.dexDesc: Relicanth is a Pokémob species that existed for a hundred million years without ever changing its form. This ancient Pokémob feeds on microscopic organisms with its toothless mouth.
entity.pokecube.luvdisc.dexDesc: Luvdisc’s heart-shaped body is a symbol of love and romance. It is said that any couple meeting this Pokémob is promised a loving relationship that never ends.
entity.pokecube.bagon.dexDesc: Bagon has a dream of one day soaring in the sky. In doomed efforts to fly, this Pokémob hurls itself off cliffs. As a result of its dives, its head has grown tough and as hard as tempered steel.
entity.pokecube.shelgon.dexDesc: Inside Shelgon’s armor-like shell, cells are in the midst of transformation to create an entirely new body. This Pokémob’s shell is extremely heavy, making its movements sluggish.
entity.pokecube.salamence.dexDesc: By evolving into Salamence, this Pokémob finally realizes its long-held dream of growing wings. To express its joy, it flies and wheels all over the sky while spouting flames from its mouth.
entity.pokecube.salamence-mega.dexDesc: Mega Evolution fuels its brutality, and it may even turn on the Trainer who raised it. It’s been dubbed “the blood-soaked crescent.”
