entity.pokecube.beldum.dexDesc: Beldum keeps itself floating by generating a magnetic force that repels earth’s natural magnetism. When it sleeps, this Pokémob anchors itself to a cliff using the hooks on its rear.
entity.pokecube.metang.dexDesc: The brains of the Beldum are joined by a magnetic nervous system. By linking its brains magnetically, this Pokémob generates strong psychokinetic power.
entity.pokecube.metagross.dexDesc: Metagross has four brains in total. Combined, the four brains can breeze through difficult calculations faster than a supercomputer. This Pokémob can float in the air by tucking in its four legs.
entity.pokecube.metagross-mega.dexDesc: Mega Evolution stimulated its brain. It emerged as a ruthless Pokémob that will clutch at any means of ensuring its victories.
entity.pokecube.regirock.dexDesc: Regirock was sealed away by people long ago. If this Pokémob’s body is damaged in battle, it is said to seek out suitable rocks on its own to repair itself.
entity.pokecube.regice.dexDesc: Regice’s body was made during an ice age. The deep-frozen body can’t be melted, even by fire. This Pokémob controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.
entity.pokecube.registeel.dexDesc: Registeel was imprisoned by people in ancient times. The metal composing its body is thought to be a curious substance that is not of this earth.
entity.pokecube.latias.dexDesc: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémob enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.
entity.pokecube.latias-mega.dexDesc: Latias is highly sensitive to the emotions of people. If it senses any hostility, this Pokémob ruffles the feathers all over its body and cries shrilly to intimidate the foe.
entity.pokecube.latios.dexDesc: Latios has the ability to make others see an image of what it has seen or imagines in its head. This Pokémob is intelligent and understands human speech.
entity.pokecube.latios-mega.dexDesc: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémob can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.
entity.pokecube.kyogre.dexDesc: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.
entity.pokecube.kyogre-primal.dexDesc: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can summon storms that cause the sea levels to rise.
entity.pokecube.groudon.dexDesc: Groudon is said to be the personification of the land itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Kyogre, as each sought to gain the power of nature.
entity.pokecube.groudon-primal.dexDesc: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.
entity.pokecube.rayquaza.dexDesc: Rayquaza is said to have lived for hundreds of millions of years. Legends remain of how it put to rest the clash between Kyogre and Groudon.
entity.pokecube.rayquaza-mega.dexDesc: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.
entity.pokecube.jirachi.dexDesc: A legend states that Jirachi will make true any wish that is written on notes attached to its head when it awakens. If this Pokémob senses danger, it will fight without awakening.
entity.pokecube.deoxys-normal.dexDesc: The DNA of a space virus underwent a sudden mutation upon exposure to a laser beam and resulted in Deoxys. The crystalline organ on this Pokémob’s chest appears to be its brain.
entity.pokecube.deoxys-attack.dexDesc: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémob shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.
entity.pokecube.deoxys-defense.dexDesc: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteorite underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.deoxys-speed.dexDesc: When it changes form, an aurora appears. It absorbs attacks by altering its cellular structure.
entity.pokecube.turtwig.dexDesc: This Pokémob becomes more energetic the more sunlight there is. The part resembling a shell is similar to silt and is slightly damp and warm to the touch.
entity.pokecube.grotle.dexDesc: Appears where there is clean spring water. The fruit that grows on the shrubs on its shell is sweet, nutritious, and truly delicious.
entity.pokecube.torterra.dexDesc: Groups of this Pokémob migrating in search of water have been mistaken for moving forests.
entity.pokecube.chimchar.dexDesc: Full of vigor and always in high spirits. It was once known by the name “Lantern-Tail” and feared as some kind of apparition.
entity.pokecube.monferno.dexDesc: The deeper the blue on its face, the more powerful it will grow to become. It leaps about every which way and lands powerful blows against its opponents with the flame on its tail.
entity.pokecube.infernape.dexDesc: It uses a special kind of martial arts involving all its limbs. Its fire never goes out.
entity.pokecube.piplup.dexDesc: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
entity.pokecube.prinplup.dexDesc: It swims gracefully through the frigid sea and sings with a voice like the roaring tide. It has powerful, sturdy wings and dignity to match.
entity.pokecube.empoleon.dexDesc: Since ancient times, it has been revered by the people of Hisui, who call it the Master of the Waves. Its wings are a match for even master-crafted blades.
entity.pokecube.starly.dexDesc: Usually with a large flock, it is barely noticeable when alone. Its cries are very strident.
entity.pokecube.staravia.dexDesc: They fly around forests and fields in search of bug Pokémob, moving together in huge flocks.
entity.pokecube.staraptor.dexDesc: It has left the flock, having gained strength enough to survive on its own. The astounding force with which Staraptor flies through the air allows it to carry away large, burly targets.
entity.pokecube.bidoof.dexDesc: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.
entity.pokecube.bibarel.dexDesc: Bibarel fur repels water and is also a fantastic material for heat retention. These Pokémobs create dams on rivers to live in.
entity.pokecube.kricketot.dexDesc: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are the hallmarks of fall evenings.
entity.pokecube.kricketune.dexDesc: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
entity.pokecube.shinx.dexDesc: Its forelegs have a muscle-based system of generating electricity. Its body shines when it is in danger.
entity.pokecube.luxio.dexDesc: Proudly uses its electrified claws as weapons. It seems to be a gracious Pokémob, evenly sharing the spoils of the hunt with others of its kind.
entity.pokecube.luxray.dexDesc: They form packs, each having one male as leader. Legends say that when Luxray’s two eyes shimmer with gold, the Pokémob can see through anything.
entity.pokecube.budew.dexDesc: When the sun’s light strengthens, the bud atop this Pokémob’s head opens. This is a sign to the people that the harsh winter is over, and the season of budding has begun.
entity.pokecube.roserade.dexDesc: Hidden within the bouquet on each hand are thorned whips loaded with virulent poison. Roserade moves gracefully as it corners its prey and mercilessly lashes them with its whips.
entity.pokecube.cranidos.dexDesc: An incredibly rare sight. They duel each other by ramming their heads together, and the resulting sound echoes throughout the area like the pealing of a bell.
entity.pokecube.rampardos.dexDesc: Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.
entity.pokecube.shieldon.dexDesc: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
entity.pokecube.bastiodon.dexDesc: Its face is sturdy—as strong as diamond—and this hardness offers a very stable defense. Much about this species is still unknown, such as its natural habitat.
entity.pokecube.burmy.dexDesc: If its cloak is even slightly damaged, Burmy will immediately repair it with whatever is close at hand. The Pokémob within the cloak is scrawny and vulnerable to the cold.
entity.pokecube.wormadam-plant.dexDesc: The cloak—fashioned from plant matter—has merged with the Pokémob and is now part of the body, like fur or skin. This fusion is an effect of the energy involved in evolution.
entity.pokecube.wormadam-sandy.dexDesc: Its earthen skin is reasonably hard—it has no problem repelling a Starly’s pecking, at least.
entity.pokecube.wormadam-trash.dexDesc: Its body, composed of refuse, blends in to the scenery so much as to be inconspicuous. This seems to be the perfect way for the Pokémob to evade the detection of predators.
entity.pokecube.mothim.dexDesc: Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite being observed feeding primarily on the nectar of flowers, Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.
entity.pokecube.combee.dexDesc: They swear fealty to a queen Pokémob and work diligently to gather nectar. Each swarm produces a different flavor of honey.
entity.pokecube.vespiquen.dexDesc: Commands its subjects to build its hive. It will dispatch any interlopers who dare sneak into its nest and use them as nourishment for itself.
entity.pokecube.pachirisu.dexDesc: A species related to the Pikachu line. Though Pachirisu is a calm Pokémob, it still presents a danger should one touch its electrified tail or cheeks.
entity.pokecube.buizel.dexDesc: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
entity.pokecube.floatzel.dexDesc: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. Floatzel carries people as if it were a rubber raft.
entity.pokecube.cherubi.dexDesc: Once the fruit growing alongside the main body is large and plump, Cherubi will use the nutrients within to evolve. The fruit then detaches, becoming nourishment for other creatures.
entity.pokecube.cherrim.dexDesc: Motionless, save for the occasional quiver. A rich array of Pokémobs can be found gathered around it, drawn by the scent exuded from Cherrim’s folded petals.
entity.pokecube.cherrim-sunny.dexDesc: Cheerfully active on sunny days. Immediately closes its petals and becomes immobile once the sun becomes hidden, however.
entity.pokecube.shellos.dexDesc: Found in abundance on seashores bordering cold waters. When pressed upon, the Pokémob will secrete from its body’s surface a purple fluid that will stain one’s clothes.
entity.pokecube.gastrodon.dexDesc: Eats beach sand for nourishment. Should one Gastrodon encounter another of a different color, a fierce battle will inevitably ensue.
entity.pokecube.ambipom.dexDesc: To affirm their kinship, members of this species will form a ring by linking their newly doubled tails together. On rare occasions, humans have been accepted into such rings.
entity.pokecube.drifloon.dexDesc: Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.
entity.pokecube.drifblim.dexDesc: It carries people and Pokémobs when it flies. But since it only drifts, it can end up anywhere.
entity.pokecube.buneary.dexDesc: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.
entity.pokecube.lopunny.dexDesc: Its fur is warm and yet remarkably light. This Pokémob kicks as though it were a master of karate, driving back its opponents with ease.
entity.pokecube.lopunny-mega.dexDesc: Mega Evolution awakens its combative instincts. It has shed any fur that got in the way of its attacks.
entity.pokecube.mismagius.dexDesc: Its cries sound like incantations. Those who hear it are tormented by headaches and hallucinations.
entity.pokecube.honchkrow.dexDesc: One cry from this Pokémob, and a murder of Murkrow come flying. At such times, one would think the curtain of night had fallen, plunging the world into jet-black darkness.
entity.pokecube.glameow.dexDesc: With its sharp glare, it puts foes in a mild hypnotic state. It is a very fickle Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.purugly.dexDesc: Though impudent and difficult to tame, Purugly enjoys great popularity due to its fur, the beauty of which surpasses even velveteen.
entity.pokecube.chingling.dexDesc: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.
entity.pokecube.stunky.dexDesc: The poison that gushes from its aft end is accompanied by an utterly evil-smelling odor with such potency that one whiff can induce memory loss.
entity.pokecube.skuntank.dexDesc: Sprays a poisonous fluid to take down prey. Sometimes, unable to stomach the stench of its own fluid, it leaves the bested prey uneaten.
entity.pokecube.bronzor.dexDesc: Floats using a mysterious energy. The pattern engraved upon its back is held as sacred and can sometimes be found in imagery from ancient cemeteries and other such timeworn places.
entity.pokecube.bronzong.dexDesc: Some believe that its bell-like cry opens holes to another world. It has been revered as a deity since ancient times.
entity.pokecube.bonsly.dexDesc: It looks as if it is always crying. It is actually adjusting its body’s fluid levels by eliminating excess.
entity.pokecube.mime-jr.dexDesc: Known to turn up in bustling marketplaces now and again. It mimics people much as a child would, then watches how they react, eyes sparkling.
entity.pokecube.happiny.dexDesc: It carries a round, egg-shaped rock in its belly pouch and gives the rock to its friends.
entity.pokecube.chatot.dexDesc: It keeps rhythm by flicking its tail feathers like a metronome. It also imitates human speech.
entity.pokecube.spiritomb.dexDesc: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.
entity.pokecube.gible.dexDesc: It nests in caves untouched by sunlight. Its sharp teeth may fall out when worn away or after an impact, but they regrow within a few days.
entity.pokecube.gabite.dexDesc: There is a long-held belief that medicine made from its scales will heal incurable illnesses.
entity.pokecube.garchomp.dexDesc: It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.
entity.pokecube.garchomp-mega.dexDesc: Its vaunted wings become scythes, sending it mad with rage. It swings its scythes wildly and slices the ground to pieces.
entity.pokecube.munchlax.dexDesc: Its robust stomach allows it to nonchalantly devour even rotted matter. It pays frequent visits to villages, seeking out food scraps intended for compost.
entity.pokecube.riolu.dexDesc: Though infantile in appearance, it has the mysterious ability to read the minds of humans. The pure of heart are met with Riolu’s approval, while those of ill nature earn only its loathing.
entity.pokecube.lucario.dexDesc: By sensing the aura emanating from others, it can read their thoughts and movements.
entity.pokecube.lucario-mega.dexDesc: Its aura has expanded due to Mega Evolution. Governed only by its combative instincts, it strikes enemies without mercy.
entity.pokecube.hippopotas.dexDesc: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.
entity.pokecube.hippowdon.dexDesc: Short-tempered and easily moved to violence. It whips up whirlwinds of sand to crush its foes’ spirits, then goes in for the attack.
entity.pokecube.skorupi.dexDesc: Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi a highly dangerous Pokémob. It seems to be weakened by cold temperatures, however.
entity.pokecube.drapion.dexDesc: Has a brutish, ferocious temperament. With immense strength and a sturdy shell off which swords will bounce, it rampages about and wreaks havoc.
entity.pokecube.croagunk.dexDesc: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
entity.pokecube.toxicroak.dexDesc: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
entity.pokecube.carnivine.dexDesc: Though this is a plant Pokémob, it has a gluttonous and unruly temperament. Carnivine attacks its prey with its cavernous maw wide open.
entity.pokecube.finneon.dexDesc: Though this is a plant Pokémob, it has a gluttonous and unruly temperament. Carnivine attacks its prey with its cavernous maw wide open.
entity.pokecube.lumineon.dexDesc: To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the seafloor using the two fins on its chest.
entity.pokecube.mantyke.dexDesc: The pattern on its back varies by region. It often swims in a school of Remoraid.
entity.pokecube.snover.dexDesc: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.
entity.pokecube.abomasnow.dexDesc: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as the Ice Monster.
entity.pokecube.abomasnow-mega.dexDesc: A powerful Pokémob that can split huge boulders with ease. Dislikes associating with others and chooses to live quietly deep within the mountains, playing with the snow.
entity.pokecube.weavile.dexDesc: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
entity.pokecube.magnezone.dexDesc: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Its three units generate magnetism.
entity.pokecube.lickilicky.dexDesc: Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky’s height. Beware of the saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.
entity.pokecube.rhyperior.dexDesc: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. On rare occasions, the Pokémob even shoots out Geodude.
entity.pokecube.tangrowth.dexDesc: Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance. It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping them around prey to ensnare them.
entity.pokecube.electivire.dexDesc: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of electricity.
entity.pokecube.magmortar.dexDesc: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
entity.pokecube.togekiss.dexDesc: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.
entity.pokecube.yanmega.dexDesc: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.
entity.pokecube.leafeon.dexDesc: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.
entity.pokecube.glaceon.dexDesc: Glaceon is able to lower its body temperature very quickly. It freezes the atmosphere, creating diamond dust that glitters like gems while it flutters and dances around.
entity.pokecube.gliscor.dexDesc: It glides soundlessly on pitch-black wings and sinks sharp fangs into the throat of its prey. It takes on a look of satisfaction once it has entirely drained its prey of blood.
entity.pokecube.mamoswine.dexDesc: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The ice age is over and the climate has warmed, so this Pokémob’s population has thinned.
entity.pokecube.porygon-z.dexDesc: Additional software was installed to make it an even better Pokémob. It began acting oddly, however.
entity.pokecube.gallade.dexDesc: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using the extending swords on its elbows.
entity.pokecube.gallade-mega.dexDesc: The blades extending from its elbows are sharper than the finest swords. Its swordsmanship, albeit self-taught, is astonishingly impressive.
entity.pokecube.probopass.dexDesc: Its entire body exudes strong magnetism. Probopass controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
entity.pokecube.dusknoir.dexDesc: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
entity.pokecube.froslass.dexDesc: It freezes foes with an icy breath that is nearly −60 degrees Fahrenheit. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
entity.pokecube.rotom.dexDesc: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.
entity.pokecube.rotom-fan.dexDesc: This Rotom has taken over a fan that has a special motor. Its gusts of wind blow its opponents away!
entity.pokecube.rotom-frost.dexDesc: Rotom assumes this form when it takes over a refrigerator powered by a special motor. It battles by spewing cold air.
entity.pokecube.rotom-heat.dexDesc: This Rotom has possessed a convection microwave oven that uses a special motor. It also has a flair for manipulating flames.
entity.pokecube.rotom-mow.dexDesc: This is Rotom after it’s seized control of a lawn mower that has a special motor. As it mows down grass, it scatters the clippings everywhere.
entity.pokecube.rotom-wash.dexDesc: This Rotom has possessed a washing machine that uses a special motor. It blasts out water to get enemies to back down.
entity.pokecube.uxie.dexDesc: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.
entity.pokecube.mesprit.dexDesc: Known as the Being of Emotion. In legend, this Pokémob was feared, as any who showed disrespect would have their emotions thrown into disarray.
entity.pokecube.azelf.dexDesc: The dreaded Being of Willpower. Legends tell of this Pokémob manipulating the will of its adversaries and turning them into puppets of its own.
entity.pokecube.dialga.dexDesc: This Pokémob is revered as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Dialga was what caused the vast river of time to begin flowing in our world.
entity.pokecube.dialga-origin.dexDesc: Radiant light caused Dialga to take on a form bearing a striking resemblance to the creator Pokémob. Dialga now wields such colossal strength that one must conclude this is its true form.
entity.pokecube.palkia.dexDesc: This Pokémob is feared as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Palkia was what caused the walls of our world to disappear, creating a sky that spans for infinity.
entity.pokecube.palkia-origin.dexDesc: It soars across the sky in a form that greatly resembles the creator of all things. Perhaps this imitation of appearance is Palkia’s strategy for gaining Arceus’s powers.
entity.pokecube.heatran.dexDesc: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
entity.pokecube.regigigas.dexDesc: It’s said that Regigigas created other Pokémob from many different materials before it moved the continents to where they are today.
entity.pokecube.giratina-altered.dexDesc: This Pokémob is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.
entity.pokecube.giratina-origin.dexDesc: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
entity.pokecube.cresselia.dexDesc: When it flies, it releases shiny particles from its veil-like wings. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
entity.pokecube.phione.dexDesc: A Pokémob that lives in warm seas. It inflates the flotation sac on its head to drift and search for food.
entity.pokecube.manaphy.dexDesc: Water makes up 80 percent of its body. This Pokémob is easily affected by its environment.
entity.pokecube.darkrai.dexDesc: It chases people and Pokémob from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.
entity.pokecube.shaymin-land.dexDesc: When the turning of seasons brings the cruel winter to its end and the joyous people give thanks to the heavens, Shaymin appears and covers the withered land with flowers.
entity.pokecube.shaymin-sky.dexDesc: Upon taking in the scent of a particular rare flower, Shaymin is enveloped in light, and its tiny body transforms.
entity.pokecube.arceus.dexDesc: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémob. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.
entity.pokecube.arceus-bug.dexDesc: It is told in mythology that this Pokémob was the first Pokémob born before the universe even existed.
entity.pokecube.arceus-dark.dexDesc: It is described in mythology as the Pokémob that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.
entity.pokecube.arceus-dragon.dexDesc: It is told in mythology that this Pokémob was born before the universe even existed.
entity.pokecube.arceus-electric.dexDesc: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémob emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
entity.pokecube.arceus-fairy.dexDesc: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing then shaped the world.
entity.pokecube.arceus-fighting.dexDesc: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.
entity.pokecube.arceus-fire.dexDesc: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémob emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
entity.pokecube.arceus-flying.dexDesc: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.
entity.pokecube.arceus-ghost.dexDesc: It is told in mythology that this Pokémob was born before the universe even existed.
entity.pokecube.arceus-grass.dexDesc: It is described in mythology as the Pokémob that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.
entity.pokecube.arceus-ground.dexDesc: It is told in mythology that this Pokémob was the first Pokémob born before the universe even existed.
entity.pokecube.arceus-ice.dexDesc: It is described in mythology as the Pokémob that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.
entity.pokecube.arceus-poison.dexDesc: It is told in mythology that this Pokémob was born before the universe even existed.
entity.pokecube.arceus-psychic.dexDesc: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémob emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
entity.pokecube.arceus-rock.dexDesc: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing then shaped the world.
entity.pokecube.arceus-steel.dexDesc: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémob emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
entity.pokecube.arceus-water.dexDesc: It is told in mythology that this Pokémob was born before the universe even existed.
entity.pokecube.victini.dexDesc: This Pokémob brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.
entity.pokecube.snivy.dexDesc: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.
entity.pokecube.servine.dexDesc: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
entity.pokecube.serperior.dexDesc: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior’s noble eyes.
entity.pokecube.tepig.dexDesc: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.
entity.pokecube.pignite.dexDesc: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.
entity.pokecube.emboar.dexDesc: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
entity.pokecube.oshawott.dexDesc: The scalchop on its stomach isn’t just used for battle--it can be used to break open hard berries as well.
entity.pokecube.dewott.dexDesc: Its exquisite double-scalchop technique is likely the result of daily training, and it can send even masters of the blade fleeing in defeat.
entity.pokecube.samurott.dexDesc: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.
entity.pokecube.samurott-hisui.dexDesc: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémob’s evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.
entity.pokecube.patrat.dexDesc: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.
entity.pokecube.watchog.dexDesc: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.
entity.pokecube.lillipup.dexDesc: Though it is a very brave Pokémob, it’s also smart enough to check its foe’s strength and avoid battle.
entity.pokecube.herdier.dexDesc: The black fur that covers this Pokémob’s body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.
entity.pokecube.stoutland.dexDesc: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.
entity.pokecube.purrloin.dexDesc: Their cute act is a ruse. They trick people and steal their valuables just to see the looks on their faces.
entity.pokecube.liepard.dexDesc: This stealthy Pokémob sneaks up behind prey without making any sound at all. It competes with Thievul for territory.
entity.pokecube.pansage.dexDesc: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.
entity.pokecube.simisage.dexDesc: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
entity.pokecube.pansear.dexDesc: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.
entity.pokecube.simisear.dexDesc: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.
entity.pokecube.panpour.dexDesc: It does not thrive in dry environments. It keeps itself damp by shooting water stored in its head tuft from its tail.
entity.pokecube.simipour.dexDesc: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.
entity.pokecube.munna.dexDesc: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it’s eating a good dream, and black when it’s eating a nightmare.
entity.pokecube.musharna.dexDesc: When dark mists emanate from its body, don’t get too near. If you do, your nightmares will become reality.
entity.pokecube.pidove.dexDesc: This very forgetful Pokémob will wait for a new order from its Trainer even though it already has one.
entity.pokecube.tranquill.dexDesc: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.
entity.pokecube.unfezant.dexDesc: Males swing the plumage on their heads to threaten others, but females are better at flying.
entity.pokecube.blitzle.dexDesc: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.
entity.pokecube.zebstrika.dexDesc: When this ill-tempered Pokémob runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
entity.pokecube.roggenrola.dexDesc: The hexagonal-shaped hole is its ear. It has a tendency to walk in the direction the sound is coming from.
entity.pokecube.boldore.dexDesc: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.
entity.pokecube.gigalith.dexDesc: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.
entity.pokecube.woobat.dexDesc: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.
entity.pokecube.swoobat.dexDesc: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.
entity.pokecube.drilbur.dexDesc: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.
entity.pokecube.excadrill.dexDesc: Forming a drill with its steel claws and head, it can bore through a steel plate, no matter how thick it is.
entity.pokecube.audino.dexDesc: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.
entity.pokecube.audino-mega.dexDesc: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.
entity.pokecube.timburr.dexDesc: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.
entity.pokecube.gurdurr.dexDesc: With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel beams to take down buildings.
entity.pokecube.conkeldurr.dexDesc: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.
entity.pokecube.tympole.dexDesc: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.
entity.pokecube.palpitoad.dexDesc: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.
entity.pokecube.seismitoad.dexDesc: By putting power into its bumps, it creates vibrations and increases the power of its punches.
entity.pokecube.throh.dexDesc: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.
entity.pokecube.sawk.dexDesc: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.
entity.pokecube.sewaddle.dexDesc: This Pokémob makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.
entity.pokecube.swadloon.dexDesc: Preferring dark, damp places, it spends the entire day eating fallen leaves that lie around it.
entity.pokecube.leavanny.dexDesc: Upon finding a small Pokémob, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.
entity.pokecube.venipede.dexDesc: Using the feelers on its head and tail, it picks up vibrations in the air to determine its prey’s location and state.
entity.pokecube.whirlipede.dexDesc: Storing energy for evolution, it sits. But, when predators approach, it moves to stab them with poison spikes.
entity.pokecube.scolipede.dexDesc: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it stops moving. Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.
entity.pokecube.cottonee.dexDesc: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
entity.pokecube.whimsicott.dexDesc: They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls of cotton in homes.
entity.pokecube.petilil.dexDesc: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.
entity.pokecube.lilligant.dexDesc: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect. It withers if a Trainer does not take good care of it.
entity.pokecube.lilligant-hisui.dexDesc: Its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.
entity.pokecube.basculin.dexDesc: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other’s school.
entity.pokecube.basculin-hisui.dexDesc: Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanor—this one is gentle—it is categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.
entity.pokecube.sandile.dexDesc: It moves along below the sand’s surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.
entity.pokecube.krokorok.dexDesc: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.
entity.pokecube.krookodile.dexDesc: Very violent Pokémob, they try to clamp down on anything that moves in front of their eyes.
entity.pokecube.darumaka.dexDesc: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.
entity.pokecube.darumaka-galar.dexDesc: It lived in snowy areas for so long that its fire sac cooled off and atrophied. It now has an organ that generates cold instead.
entity.pokecube.darmanitan-standard.dexD: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.
entity.pokecube.darmanitan-galar-standar: On days when blizzards blow through, it comes down to where people live. It stashes food in the snowball on its head, taking it home for later.
entity.pokecube.darmanitan-zen.dexDesc: Through meditation, it calms its raging spirit and hones its psychic powers.
entity.pokecube.darmanitan-galar-zen.dex: Anger has reignited its atrophied flame sac. This Pokémob spews fire everywhere as it rampages indiscriminately.
entity.pokecube.maractus.dexDesc: When it moves rhythmically, it makes a sound similar to maracas, making the surprised Pokémob flee.
entity.pokecube.dwebble.dexDesc: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémob remains agitated until it locates a replacement.
entity.pokecube.crustle.dexDesc: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.
entity.pokecube.scraggy.dexDesc: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
entity.pokecube.scrafty.dexDesc: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.
entity.pokecube.sigilyph.dexDesc: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.
entity.pokecube.yamask.dexDesc: These Pokémobs arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.
entity.pokecube.yamask-galar.dexDesc: A clay slab with cursed engravings took possession of a Yamask. The slab is said to be absorbing the Yamask’s dark power.
entity.pokecube.cofagrigus.dexDesc: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
entity.pokecube.tirtouga.dexDesc: About 100 million years ago, these Pokémobs swam in oceans. It is thought they also went on land to attack prey.
entity.pokecube.carracosta.dexDesc: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.
entity.pokecube.archen.dexDesc: It was revived from an ancient fossil. Not able to fly, it lived in treetops and hopped from one branch to another.
entity.pokecube.archeops.dexDesc: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.
entity.pokecube.trubbish.dexDesc: The combination of garbage bags and industrial waste caused the chemical reaction that created this Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.garbodor.dexDesc: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.
entity.pokecube.garbodor-gmax.dexDesc: Due to Gigantamax energy, this Pokémob’s toxic gas has become much thicker, congealing into masses shaped like discarded toys.
entity.pokecube.zorua.dexDesc: It changes so it looks just like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.
entity.pokecube.zorua-hisui.dexDesc: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.
entity.pokecube.zoroark.dexDesc: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.
entity.pokecube.zoroark-hisui.dexDesc: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark’s own body.
entity.pokecube.minccino.dexDesc: These Pokémobs prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.
entity.pokecube.cinccino.dexDesc: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.
entity.pokecube.gothita.dexDesc: It stares intently at everything. It can become so obsessed with watching that it doesn’t notice attacks.
entity.pokecube.gothorita.dexDesc: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.
entity.pokecube.gothitelle.dexDesc: It can see the future from the movement of the stars. When it learns its Trainer’s life span, it cries in sadness.
entity.pokecube.solosis.dexDesc: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter how severe.
entity.pokecube.duosion.dexDesc: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.
entity.pokecube.reuniclus.dexDesc: They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. They can crush boulders psychically.
entity.pokecube.ducklett.dexDesc: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.
entity.pokecube.swanna.dexDesc: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.
entity.pokecube.vanillite.dexDesc: The temperature of their breath is -58 degrees Fahrenheit. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.
entity.pokecube.vanillish.dexDesc: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.
entity.pokecube.vanilluxe.dexDesc: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry, cause violent blizzards.
entity.pokecube.deerling.dexDesc: Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.
entity.pokecube.sawsbuck.dexDesc: The plants growing on its horns change according to the season. The leaders of the herd possess magnificent horns.
entity.pokecube.emolga.dexDesc: It glides on its outstretched membrane while shocking foes with the electricity stored in the pouches on its cheeks.
entity.pokecube.karrablast.dexDesc: When they feel threatened, they spit an acidic liquid to drive attackers away. This Pokémob targets Shelmet.
entity.pokecube.escavalier.dexDesc: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.
entity.pokecube.foongus.dexDesc: It lures people in with its Poké Cube pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Cube is unknown.
entity.pokecube.amoonguss.dexDesc: It moves the caps on both arms and does a dance to lure prey. It prefers damp places.
entity.pokecube.frillish.dexDesc: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.
entity.pokecube.jellicent.dexDesc: They propel themselves by expelling absorbed seawater from their bodies. Their favorite food is life energy.
entity.pokecube.alomomola.dexDesc: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémob, they embrace it and bring it to shore.
entity.pokecube.joltik.dexDesc: Since it can’t generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémob and absorbs static electricity.
entity.pokecube.galvantula.dexDesc: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.
entity.pokecube.ferroseed.dexDesc: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.
entity.pokecube.ferrothorn.dexDesc: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.
entity.pokecube.klink.dexDesc: Two bodies comprise a fixed pair. They spin around each other to generate energy.
entity.pokecube.klang.dexDesc: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn’t return, it will die.
entity.pokecube.klinklang.dexDesc: The minigear spins at high speed. Then the energy from the red core charges the minigear to make it ready to fire.
entity.pokecube.tynamo.dexDesc: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.
entity.pokecube.eelektrik.dexDesc: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.
entity.pokecube.eelektross.dexDesc: It latches on to prey with its sucker mouth, sinking in its fangs and shocking the prey with powerful electricity.
entity.pokecube.elgyem.dexDesc: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent’s brain, causing unendurable headaches.
entity.pokecube.beheeyem.dexDesc: It has strong psychic powers. Using its fingers that flash three different colors, it controls its opponents and rewrites their memories.
entity.pokecube.litwick.dexDesc: Its flame is usually out, but it starts shining when it absorbs life force from people or Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.lampent.dexDesc: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.
entity.pokecube.chandelure.dexDesc: Being consumed in Chandelure’s flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
entity.pokecube.axew.dexDesc: Its large tusks have a tendency to break, but each time they grow back, they grow in harder and sturdier.
entity.pokecube.fraxure.dexDesc: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.
entity.pokecube.haxorus.dexDesc: Its tusks are incredibly destructive. They can easily slice through a thick, sturdy steel column every time.
entity.pokecube.cubchoo.dexDesc: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.
entity.pokecube.beartic.dexDesc: They love the cold seas of the north. They create pathways across the ocean waters by freezing their own breath.
entity.pokecube.cryogonal.dexDesc: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.
entity.pokecube.shelmet.dexDesc: When attacked, it defends itself by closing the lid of its shell. It can spit a sticky, poisonous liquid.
entity.pokecube.accelgor.dexDesc: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.
entity.pokecube.stunfisk.dexDesc: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.
entity.pokecube.stunfisk-galar.dexDesc: Its conspicuous lips lure prey in as it lies in wait in the mud. When prey gets close, Stunfisk clamps its jagged steel fins down on them.
entity.pokecube.mienfoo.dexDesc: It takes pride in the speed at which it can use moves. What it loses in power, it makes up for in quantity.
entity.pokecube.mienshao.dexDesc: Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it launches into combo attacks that, once started, no one can stop.
entity.pokecube.druddigon.dexDesc: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.
entity.pokecube.golett.dexDesc: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémob from clay. It’s been active for thousands of years.
entity.pokecube.golurk.dexDesc: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémob by the ancient people who made them.
entity.pokecube.pawniard.dexDesc: Blades comprise this Pokémob’s entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.
entity.pokecube.bisharp.dexDesc: This pitiless Pokémob commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
entity.pokecube.bouffalant.dexDesc: They are known to charge so wildly that if a train were to enter their territory, they would send it flying.
entity.pokecube.rufflet.dexDesc: It stands up to massive opponents, not out of courage, but out of recklessness. But that is how it gets stronger.
entity.pokecube.braviary.dexDesc: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.
entity.pokecube.braviary-hisui.dexDesc: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémob goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water’s surface.
entity.pokecube.vullaby.dexDesc: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.
entity.pokecube.mandibuzz.dexDesc: It circles in the sky, keeping a keen eye out for Pokémob in a weakened state. Its choicest food is Cubone.
entity.pokecube.heatmor.dexDesc: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.
entity.pokecube.durant.dexDesc: They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.
entity.pokecube.deino.dexDesc: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.
entity.pokecube.zweilous.dexDesc: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
entity.pokecube.hydreigon.dexDesc: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
entity.pokecube.larvesta.dexDesc: Said to have been born from the sun, it spews fire from its horns and encases itself in a cocoon of fire when it evolves.
entity.pokecube.volcarona.dexDesc: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.
entity.pokecube.cobalion.dexDesc: From the moment it’s born, this Pokémob radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will calm even vicious foes.
entity.pokecube.terrakion.dexDesc: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémob used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.virizion.dexDesc: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.
entity.pokecube.tornadus-incarnate.dexDe: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.
entity.pokecube.tornadus-therian.dexDesc: This strange avian guise is thought to be Tornadus’s true form. Tornadus has been sighted crossing the ocean while in this form.
entity.pokecube.thundurus-incarnate.dexD: They say this wielder of electricity has waged war with its nemesis, Tornadus, since time immemorial. The lightning bolts it hurls pierce the very earth and enrich the soil.
entity.pokecube.thundurus-therian.dexDes: Quick as a flash, it materializes out of nowhere. It pulverizes foes into nothingness with showers of devastatingly powerful lightning bolts launched from the string of orbs on its tail.
entity.pokecube.reshiram.dexDesc: This legendary Pokémob can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.
entity.pokecube.zekrom.dexDesc: This legendary Pokémob can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.
entity.pokecube.landorus-incarnate.dexDe: When the incarnations of wind and of lightning clash, Landorus arrives to quell the conflict. After the tempests and thunderbolts abate, the land is sure to be blessed with bountiful harvests.
entity.pokecube.landorus-therian.dexDesc: Landorus soars through the sky in this form, bestowing plentiful harvests upon the land and earning the people’s reverence. It can traverse the whole of Hisui in a mere couple of hours.
entity.pokecube.kyurem.dexDesc: This legendary ice Pokémob waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.
entity.pokecube.kyurem-black.dexDesc: It’s said that this Pokémob battles in order to protect the ideal world that will exist in the future for people and Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.kyurem-white.dexDesc: It has foreseen that a world of truth will arrive for people and Pokémob. It strives to protect that future.
entity.pokecube.keldeo-ordinary.dexDesc: Cobalion, Terrakion, and Virizion taught this Pokémob how to fight. It dashes across the world, seeking more opportunities to further its training.
entity.pokecube.keldeo-resolute.dexDesc: The power that lay hidden in its body now covers its horn, turning it into a sword that can slice through anything.
entity.pokecube.meloetta-aria.dexDesc: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
entity.pokecube.meloetta-pirouette.dexDe: Many famous songs have been inspired by the melodies that Meloetta plays.
entity.pokecube.genesect.dexDesc: This Pokémob existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
entity.pokecube.genesectbdrive.dexDesc: This ancient bug Pokémob was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
entity.pokecube.genesectcdrive.dexDesc: ver 300 million years ago, it was feared as the strongest of hunters. It has been modified by Team Plasma.
entity.pokecube.genesectddrive.dexDesc: This Pokémob existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
entity.pokecube.genesectsdrive.dexDesc: This ancient bug Pokémob was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
entity.pokecube.chespin.dexDesc: Many famous songs have been inspired by the melodies that Meloetta plays.
entity.pokecube.quilladin.dexDesc: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.
entity.pokecube.chesnaught.dexDesc: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.
entity.pokecube.fennekin.dexDesc: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.
entity.pokecube.braixen.dexDesc: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.
entity.pokecube.delphox.dexDesc: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.
entity.pokecube.froakie.dexDesc: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.
entity.pokecube.frogadier.dexDesc: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.
entity.pokecube.greninja.dexDesc: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
entity.pokecube.greninja-ash.dexDesc: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.
entity.pokecube.bunnelby.dexDesc: It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.
entity.pokecube.diggersby.dexDesc: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it’s finished digging, it lounges lazily.
entity.pokecube.fletchling.dexDesc: These friendly Pokémobs send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.
entity.pokecube.fletchinder.dexDesc: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.
entity.pokecube.talonflame.dexDesc: Its favorite foods are Wingull and Pikipek. It attacks with a powerful kick and grasps them firmly in its talons.
entity.pokecube.scatterbug.dexDesc: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.
entity.pokecube.spewpa.dexDesc: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.
entity.pokecube.vivillon.dexDesc: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entity.pokecube.vivillon-elegant.dexDesc: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entity.pokecube.vivillon-end.dexDesc: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entity.pokecube.vivillon-hell.dexDesc: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entity.pokecube.vivillon-highplains.dexD: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entity.pokecube.vivillon-icysnow.dexDesc: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entity.pokecube.vivillon-modern.dexDesc: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entity.pokecube.vivillon-monsoon.dexDesc: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entity.pokecube.vivillon-ocean.dexDesc: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entity.pokecube.vivillon-polar.dexDesc: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entity.pokecube.vivillon-sandstorm.dexDe: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entity.pokecube.vivillon-sun.dexDesc: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entity.pokecube.litleo.dexDesc: When they’re young, they live with a pride. Once they’re able to hunt prey on their own, they’re kicked out and have to make their own way.
entity.pokecube.pyroar.dexDesc: The males are usually lazy, but when attacked by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends with no regard for its own safety.
entity.pokecube.flabebe.dexDesc: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind’s embrace with an untroubled heart.
entity.pokecube.floette.dexDesc: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.
entity.pokecube.floette-eternal.dexDesc: The flower it’s holding can no longer be found blooming anywhere. It’s also thought to contain terrifying power.
entity.pokecube.florges.dexDesc: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.
entity.pokecube.skiddo.dexDesc: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.
entity.pokecube.gogoat.dexDesc: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.
entity.pokecube.pancham.dexDesc: There’s no point to the leaf in its mouth, aside from an effort to look cool. It’s mischievous, so it’s not well suited to inexperienced Trainers.
entity.pokecube.pangoro.dexDesc: Although it possesses a violent temperament, it won’t put up with bullying. It uses the leaf in its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.
entity.pokecube.furfrou.dexDesc: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémobs were the designated guardians of the king.
entity.pokecube.espurr.dexDesc: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.
entity.pokecube.meowstic-male.dexDesc: The defensive instinct of the males is strong. It's when they're protecting themselves or their partners that they unleash their full power.
entity.pokecube.meowstic-female.dexDesc: Females are a bit more selfish and aggressive than males. If they don't get what they want, they will torment you with their psychic abilities.
entity.pokecube.honedge.dexDesc: Apparently this Pokémob is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.
entity.pokecube.doublade.dexDesc: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.
entity.pokecube.aegislash-blade.dexDesc: This stance is dedicated to offense. It can cleave any opponent with the strength and weight of its steel blade.
entity.pokecube.aegislash-shield.dexDesc: In this defensive stance, Aegislash uses its steel body and a force field of spectral power to reduce the damage of any attack.
entity.pokecube.spritzee.dexDesc: A scent pouch within this Pokémob’s body allows it to create various scents. A change in its diet will alter the fragrance it produces.
entity.pokecube.aromatisse.dexDesc: The scents Aromatisse can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponent’s will to fight.
entity.pokecube.swirlix.dexDesc: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémob spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.
entity.pokecube.slurpuff.dexDesc: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a human’s, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. It’s like it can see with its nose!
entity.pokecube.inkay.dexDesc: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent’s will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.
entity.pokecube.malamar.dexDesc: It flashes the pattern on its torso to control its prey and draw them in. The edges of its fins are supremely sharp.
entity.pokecube.binacle.dexDesc: After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.
entity.pokecube.barbaracle.dexDesc: Seven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.
entity.pokecube.skrelp.dexDesc: Disguised by its shape, Skrelp pretends to be a piece of seaweed. When prey gets too close, Skrelp bathes it in poison to keep it from struggling.
entity.pokecube.dragalge.dexDesc: Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking the plume on its head out above the ocean’s surface and bathing it in sunlight.
entity.pokecube.clauncher.dexDesc: It has an oversized claw on one of its arms. This useful claw can seize prey and shoot water at others as a projectile.
entity.pokecube.clawitzer.dexDesc: It compresses the water it has sucked up and then projects it with enough power to punch a hole right through a thick sheet of iron.
entity.pokecube.helioptile.dexDesc: It charges itself by bathing in the light of the sun, providing it with enough energy that it doesn't need to eat.
entity.pokecube.heliolisk.dexDesc: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.
entity.pokecube.tyrunt.dexDesc: This Pokémob was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn’t like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.
entity.pokecube.tyrantrum.dexDesc: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.
entity.pokecube.amaura.dexDesc: This Pokémob was successfully restored from a fossil. In the past, it lived with others of its kind in cold lands where there were fewer predators.
entity.pokecube.aurorus.dexDesc: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.
entity.pokecube.sylveon.dexDesc: Its ribbonlike feelers give off an aura that weakens hostility in its prey, causing them to let down their guard. Then it attacks.
entity.pokecube.hawlucha.dexDesc: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.
entity.pokecube.dedenne.dexDesc: By emitting radio waves from its antenna-shaped whiskers, it can communicate with far-off allies. Dedenne can also plug its tail into outlets to drain electricity from them.
entity.pokecube.carbink.dexDesc: Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
entity.pokecube.goomy.dexDesc: Goomy hides away in the shade of trees, where it’s nice and humid. If the slime coating its body dries out, the Pokémob instantly becomes lethargic.
entity.pokecube.sliggoo.dexDesc: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can’t see anything.
entity.pokecube.sliggoo-hisui.dexDesc: A creature given to melancholy. Its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in Hisui’s water.
entity.pokecube.goodra.dexDesc: It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch that’s the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.
entity.pokecube.goodra-hisui.dexDesc: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.
entity.pokecube.klefki.dexDesc: This Pokémob is constantly collecting keys. Entrust a Klefki with important keys, and the Pokémob will protect them no matter what.
entity.pokecube.phantump.dexDesc: According to old tales, these Pokémobs are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.
entity.pokecube.trevenant.dexDesc: This Pokémob controls trees via roots stretching from its feet, and it will attack anyone that dares to ravage the forest.
entity.pokecube.pumpkaboo-average.dexDes: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémob that see it.
entity.pokecube.pumpkaboo-large.dexDesc: When taking spirits to the afterlife, large Pumpkaboo prefer the spirits of adults to those of children.
entity.pokecube.pumpkaboo-small.dexDesc: When taking spirits to the afterlife, small Pumpkaboo prefer the spirits of children to those of adults.
entity.pokecube.pumpkaboo-super.dexDesc: Massive Pumpkaboo are said to be the product of areas where a great number of lost souls lingered.
entity.pokecube.gourgeist-average.dexDes: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.
entity.pokecube.gourgeist-large.dexDesc: Large Gourgeist put on the guise of adults, taking the hands of children to lead them to the afterlife.
entity.pokecube.gourgeist-small.dexDesc: Small Gourgeist pretend to be children to fool adults. Anyone who falls for the act gets carried away to the hereafter.
entity.pokecube.gourgeist-super.dexDesc: Supersized Gourgeist aren’t picky. They will forcefully drag anyone off to the afterlife.
entity.pokecube.bergmite.dexDesc: It blocks opponents’ attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
entity.pokecube.avalugg.dexDesc: As Avalugg moves about during the day, the cracks in its body deepen. The Pokémob’s body returns to a pristine state overnight.
entity.pokecube.avalugg-hisui.dexDesc: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémob barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.
entity.pokecube.noibat.dexDesc: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
entity.pokecube.noivern.dexDesc: It is extremely combative toward anything that wanders too close to it. It flies through even the darkest nights using ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears. Noivern loves fruit, and feeding it fruit will keep it calm.
entity.pokecube.xerneas.dexDesc: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
entity.pokecube.yveltal.dexDesc: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.
entity.pokecube.zygarde-50.dexDesc: This is Zygarde’s form when about half of its pieces have been assembled. It plays the role of monitoring the ecosystem.
entity.pokecube.zygarde-10.dexDesc: Its sharp fangs make short work of finishing off its enemies, but it’s unable to maintain this body indefinitely. After a period of time, it falls apart.
entity.pokecube.zygarde-100.dexDesc: This is Zygarde’s perfected form. From the orifice on its chest, it radiates high-powered energy that eliminates everything.
entity.pokecube.diancie.dexDesc: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
entity.pokecube.diancie-mega.dexDesc: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
entity.pokecube.hoopa.dexDesc: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.
entity.pokecube.hoopa-unbound.dexDesc: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.
entity.pokecube.volcanion.dexDesc: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
entity.pokecube.rowlet.dexDesc: Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.
entity.pokecube.dartrix.dexDesc: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.
entity.pokecube.decidueye.dexDesc: It nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at opponents. When it simply can’t afford to miss, it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.
entity.pokecube.decidueye-hisui.dexDesc: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye’s feathers insulates the Pokémob against Hisui’s extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.
entity.pokecube.litten.dexDesc: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.
entity.pokecube.torracat.dexDesc: It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémob, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer’s whole body covered in scratches.
entity.pokecube.incineroar.dexDesc: Although it’s rough mannered and egotistical, it finds beating down unworthy opponents boring. It gets motivated for stronger opponents.
entity.pokecube.popplio.dexDesc: This Pokémob can control water bubbles. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.
entity.pokecube.brionne.dexDesc: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.
entity.pokecube.primarina.dexDesc: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokémob’s Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.
entity.pokecube.pikipek.dexDesc: This Pokémob feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.
entity.pokecube.trumbeak.dexDesc: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.
entity.pokecube.toucannon.dexDesc: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.
entity.pokecube.yungoos.dexDesc: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.
entity.pokecube.gumshoos.dexDesc: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as it’s diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokémob boasts incredible patience.
entity.pokecube.grubbin.dexDesc: It spits a sticky thread to stop opponents in their tracks, and then it grabs them in its sharp, sturdy mandibles to take them down.
entity.pokecube.charjabug.dexDesc: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.
entity.pokecube.vikavolt.dexDesc: It has an organ that generates electricity in its abdomen. It concentrates energy in its strong jaws and fires off powerful jolts of electricity.
entity.pokecube.crabrawler.dexDesc: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.
entity.pokecube.crabominable.dexDesc: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!
entity.pokecube.oricorio-baile.dexDesc: It wins the hearts of its enemies with its passionate dancing and then uses the opening it creates to burn them up with blazing flames.
entity.pokecube.oricorio-pau.dexDesc: It creates an electric charge by rubbing its feathers together. It dances over to its enemies and delivers shocking electrical punches.
entity.pokecube.oricorio-pom-pom.dexDesc: This Oricorio relaxes by swaying gently. This increases its psychic energy, which it then fires at its enemies.
entity.pokecube.oricorio-sensu.dexDesc: It charms its opponents with its refined dancing. When they let their guard down, it places a curse on them that will bring on their demise.
entity.pokecube.cutiefly.dexDesc: Cutiefly can pick up the auras of living things. It skillfully reads those auras to predict its foes’ movements and make fools of them.
entity.pokecube.ribombee.dexDesc: It can predict the weather from moisture levels and wind direction. Ribombee only reveals itself when there are a few clear days in a row.
entity.pokecube.rockruff.dexDesc: As they develop, their disposition grows more violent and aggressive. Many Trainers find them too much to handle and abandon them.
entity.pokecube.lycanroc-midday.dexDesc: With swift movements, this Pokémob gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are always aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.
entity.pokecube.lycanroc-dusk.dexDesc: Bathed in the setting sun of evening, Lycanroc has undergone a special kind of evolution. An intense fighting spirit underlies its calmness.
entity.pokecube.lycanroc-midnight.dexDes: The more intimidating the opponent it faces, the more this Pokémob’s blood boils. It will attack with no regard for its own safety.
entity.pokecube.wishiwashi-solo.dexDesc: When it’s in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.
entity.pokecube.wishiwashi-school.dexDes: Weak Wishiwashi school together to concentrate their power. Their united force makes them the demon of the sea, feared near and far.
entity.pokecube.mareanie.dexDesc: Aside from its head, its body parts regenerate quickly if they’re cut off. After a good night’s sleep, Mareanie is back to normal.
entity.pokecube.toxapex.dexDesc: With its 12 legs, it creates a dome to shelter within. The flow of the tides doesn’t affect Toxapex in there, so it’s very comfortable.
entity.pokecube.mudbray.dexDesc: Possessing mighty power, Mudbray can be loaded with 50 times its own body weight and will be totally fine.
entity.pokecube.mudsdale.dexDesc: Mud that hardens around a Mudsdale’s legs sets harder than stone. It’s so hard that it allows this Pokémob to scrap a truck with a single kick.
entity.pokecube.dewpider.dexDesc: It can only breathe oxygen that has dissolved in water, so it wears a water bubble on its head when it walks around on land.
entity.pokecube.araquanid.dexDesc: It has a habit of storing things it values in its water bubble. If its Trainer doesn’t watch out, Araquanid will try to put them in its bubble!
entity.pokecube.fomantis.dexDesc: When the sun rises, Fomantis spreads its four leaves and bathes in the sunlight. The tip of its head has a pleasant aroma.
entity.pokecube.lurantis.dexDesc: As it slashes into its enemies, it looks like it’s dancing. Its elegant appearance has led some to call it the most glamorous Grass Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.morelull.dexDesc: It scatters its shining spores around itself. Even though they’re dangerous, nighttime tours of forests where Morelull live are popular.
entity.pokecube.shiinotic.dexDesc: It puts its prey to sleep and siphons off their vitality through the tip of its arms. If one of its kind is weakened, it helps by sending it vitality.
entity.pokecube.salandit.dexDesc: The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can’t evolve.
entity.pokecube.salazzle.dexDesc: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.
entity.pokecube.stufful.dexDesc: A touch from anyone except a known friend sends it into a surging frenzy. It’s an incredibly dangerous Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.bewear.dexDesc: It waves its hands wildly in intimidation and warning. Life is over for anyone who doesn’t run away as fast as possible.
entity.pokecube.bounsweet.dexDesc: Because of its sweet, delicious aroma, bird Pokémob are always after it, but it’s not intelligent enough to care.
entity.pokecube.steenee.dexDesc: It’s protected by its hard sepals, so it plays with bird Pokémobs without worry. They peck it relentlessly, but it doesn’t care.
entity.pokecube.tsareena.dexDesc: A Pokémob with an aggressive personality and a mastery of kicking, it cackles every time it kicks an opponent.
entity.pokecube.comfey.dexDesc: It picks flowers and sticks them to its body with fluids it produces. The aroma that wafts from its petals has a healing effect.
entity.pokecube.oranguru.dexDesc: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémob abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.
entity.pokecube.passimian.dexDesc: Berries are its weapons as well as the staple of its diet. The one that can throw a berry the farthest is the boss of the troop.
entity.pokecube.wimpod.dexDesc: An astonishingly cowardly Pokémob, Wimpod will whir its legs at high speeds to run away if anything comes near it.
entity.pokecube.golisopod.dexDesc: It will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.
entity.pokecube.sandygast.dexDesc: It likes the shovel on its head, so Sandygast will get serious and fight any children who come to take it back.
entity.pokecube.palossand.dexDesc: Palossand is known as the Beach Nightmare. It pulls its prey down into the sand by controlling the sand itself, and then it sucks out their souls.
entity.pokecube.pyukumuku.dexDesc: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.
entity.pokecube.type-null.dexDesc: A Pokémob weapon developed for a specific mission, it went berserk during an experiment, so it was cryogenically frozen.
entity.pokecube.silvally.dexDesc: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokémob is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.
entity.pokecube.silvally-bug.dexDesc: Although its name was Type: Null at first, the boy who evolved it into this form gave it the name by which it is now known.
entity.pokecube.silvally-dark.dexDesc: This is its form once it has awakened and evolved. Freed from its heavy mask, its speed is greatly increased.
