entity.pokecube.silvally-dragon.dexDesc: Through the bond it formed with its Trainer, its will was strengthened, and it was able to destroy its control mask.
entity.pokecube.silvally-electric.dexDes: A solid bond of trust between this Pokémob and its Trainer awakened the strength hidden within Silvally. It can change its type at will.
entity.pokecube.silvally-fairy.dexDesc: The final factor needed to release this Pokémob’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.
entity.pokecube.silvally-fighting.dexDes: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
entity.pokecube.silvally-fire.dexDesc: Upon awakening, its RKS System is activated. By employing specific memories, this Pokémob can adapt its type to confound its enemies.
entity.pokecube.silvally-flying.dexDesc: Having been awakened successfully, it can change its type and battle—just like a certain Pokémob depicted in legends.
entity.pokecube.silvally-ghost.dexDesc: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
entity.pokecube.silvally-grass.dexDesc: Thanks to its awakened powers, it can change to the grass type to match the memory it has equipped.
entity.pokecube.silvally-ground.dexDesc: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory it’s holding. This is its ground-type form.
entity.pokecube.silvally-ice.dexDesc: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokémob is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.
entity.pokecube.silvally-poison.dexDesc: This is its form once it has awakened and evolved. Freed from its heavy mask, its speed is greatly increased.
entity.pokecube.silvally-psychic.dexDesc: Through the bond it formed with its Trainer, its will was strengthened, and it was able to destroy its control mask.
entity.pokecube.silvally-rock.dexDesc: A solid bond of trust between this Pokémob and its Trainer awakened the strength hidden within Silvally. It can change its type at will.
entity.pokecube.silvally-steel.dexDesc: The final factor needed to release this Pokémob’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.
entity.pokecube.silvally-water.dexDesc: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
entity.pokecube.minior-meteor.dexDesc: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokémob was born from mutated nanoparticles.
entity.pokecube.minior-blue.dexDesc: It eats dust in the atmosphere. The composition of the dust determines the color of its core.
entity.pokecube.minior-green.dexDesc: If its core stays exposed, it will soon die off. It’s possible that it may survive if it’s put into a Poké Cube quickly enough.
entity.pokecube.minior-indigo.dexDesc: Places where Minior fall from the night sky are few and far between, with Alola being one of the precious few.
entity.pokecube.minior-orange.dexDesc: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
entity.pokecube.minior-red.dexDesc: It eats dust in the atmosphere. The composition of the dust determines the color of its core.
entity.pokecube.minior-violet.dexDesc: If its core stays exposed, it will soon die off. It’s possible that it may survive if it’s put into a Poké Cube quickly enough.
entity.pokecube.minior-yellow.dexDesc: Places where Minior fall from the night sky are few and far between, with Alola being one of the precious few.
entity.pokecube.komala.dexDesc: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.
entity.pokecube.turtonator.dexDesc: It lives in volcanoes and eats sulfur and other minerals. Materials from the food it eats form the basis of its explosive shell.
entity.pokecube.togedemaru.dexDesc: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.
entity.pokecube.mimikyu-disguised.dexDes: A gust of wind revealed what hides under this Pokémob’s rag to a passing Trainer, who went home and died painfully that very night.
entity.pokecube.bruxish.dexDesc: It burrows beneath the sand, radiating psychic power from the protuberance on its head. It waits for prey as it surveys the area.
entity.pokecube.drampa.dexDesc: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémob—up until it’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.
entity.pokecube.dhelmise.dexDesc: The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokémob. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.
entity.pokecube.jangmo-o.dexDesc: It smacks the scales on its head against rocks or against the ground to frighten its opponents. It can also contact its friends with these noises.
entity.pokecube.hakamo-o.dexDesc: It makes noise by clanging its scales together. When the rhythm has reached its peak, Hakamo-o attacks.
entity.pokecube.kommo-o.dexDesc: Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other commodities.
entity.pokecube.tapu-koko.dexDesc: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.
entity.pokecube.tapu-lele.dexDesc: It heals the wounds of people and Pokémob by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.
entity.pokecube.tapu-bulu.dexDesc: The guardian deity of Ula’ula is a lazy Pokémob. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.
entity.pokecube.tapu-fini.dexDesc: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.
entity.pokecube.cosmog.dexDesc: This Pokémob came from another universe. Its gaseous body is so light that even a gentle breeze can blow it away.
entity.pokecube.cosmoem.dexDesc: The absorption of starlight fuels this Pokémob’s growth. The shell that encases it is harder than any known material.
entity.pokecube.solgaleo.dexDesc: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
entity.pokecube.solgaleo-dusk.dexDesc: This is Necrozma’s form while it’s absorbing the power of Solgaleo, making it extremely ferocious and impossible to control.
entity.pokecube.lunala.dexDesc: Said to live in another world, this Pokémob devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.
entity.pokecube.lunala-dawn.dexDesc: Lunala no longer has a will of its own. Now under the control of Necrozma, it continuously expels all of its energy.
entity.pokecube.nihilego.dexDesc: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.buzzwole.dexDesc: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.
entity.pokecube.pheromosa.dexDesc: A life-form that lives in another world, its body is thin and supple, but it also possesses great power.
entity.pokecube.xurkitree.dexDesc: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.
entity.pokecube.celesteela.dexDesc: One of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings can be detected coming from both of its huge arms.
entity.pokecube.kartana.dexDesc: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.
entity.pokecube.guzzlord.dexDesc: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.
entity.pokecube.necrozma.dexDesc: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
entity.pokecube.necrozma-ultra.dexDesc: This is its form when it has absorbed overwhelming light energy. It fires laser beams from all over its body.
entity.pokecube.magearna.dexDesc: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.
entity.pokecube.marshadow.dexDesc: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it’s imitating.
entity.pokecube.poipole.dexDesc: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.
entity.pokecube.naganadel.dexDesc: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.
entity.pokecube.stakataka.dexDesc: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.
entity.pokecube.blacephalon.dexDesc: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It’s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
entity.pokecube.zeraora.dexDesc: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they’ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.
entity.pokecube.meltan.dexDesc: It dissolves and eats metal. Circulating liquid metal within its body is how it generates energy.
entity.pokecube.melmetal.dexDesc: At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.
entity.pokecube.melmetal-gmax.dexDesc: It can send electric beams streaking out from the hole in its belly. The beams’ tremendous energy can vaporize an opponent in one shot.
entity.pokecube.grookey.dexDesc: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.
entity.pokecube.thwackey.dexDesc: When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.
entity.pokecube.rillaboom.dexDesc: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.
entity.pokecube.rillaboom-gmax.dexDesc: Gigantamax energy has caused Rillaboom’s stump to grow into a drum set that resembles a forest.
entity.pokecube.scorbunny.dexDesc: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.
entity.pokecube.raboot.dexDesc: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.
entity.pokecube.cinderace.dexDesc: It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.
entity.pokecube.cinderace-gmax.dexDesc: Infused with Cinderace’s fighting spirit, the gigantic Pyro Ball never misses its targets and completely roasts opponents.
entity.pokecube.sobble.dexDesc: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémob becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.
entity.pokecube.drizzile.dexDesc: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.
entity.pokecube.inteleon.dexDesc: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’ weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.
entity.pokecube.inteleon-gmax.dexDesc: Gigantamax Inteleon’s Water Gun move fires at Mach 7. As the Pokémob takes aim, it uses the crest on its head to gauge wind and temperature.
entity.pokecube.skwovet.dexDesc: Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémob becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.
entity.pokecube.greedent.dexDesc: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémob is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn’t notice the loss.
entity.pokecube.rookidee.dexDesc: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokémob takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.
entity.pokecube.corvisquire.dexDesc: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponent’s strength.
entity.pokecube.corviknight.dexDesc: This Pokémob reigns supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.
entity.pokecube.corviknight-gmax.dexDesc: Imbued with Gigantamax energy, its wings can whip up winds more forceful than any a hurricane could muster. The gusts blow everything away.
entity.pokecube.blipbug.dexDesc: A constant collector of information, this Pokémob is very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.
entity.pokecube.dottler.dexDesc: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.
entity.pokecube.orbeetle.dexDesc: It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.
entity.pokecube.orbeetle-gmax.dexDesc: Its brain has grown to a gargantuan size, as has the rest of its body. This Pokémob’s intellect and psychic abilities are overpowering.
entity.pokecube.nickit.dexDesc: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémob. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.
entity.pokecube.thievul.dexDesc: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.
entity.pokecube.gossifleur.dexDesc: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.eldegoss.dexDesc: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémob can benefit from them.
entity.pokecube.wooloo.dexDesc: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémob could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.
entity.pokecube.dubwool.dexDesc: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.
entity.pokecube.chewtle.dexDesc: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémob bites down and never lets go.
entity.pokecube.drednaw.dexDesc: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémob chomps down on its unfortunate prey.
entity.pokecube.drednaw-gmax.dexDesc: It responded to Gigantamax energy by becoming bipedal. First it comes crashing down on foes, and then it finishes them off with its massive jaws.
entity.pokecube.yamper.dexDesc: This gluttonous Pokémob only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.
entity.pokecube.boltund.dexDesc: This Pokémob generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.
entity.pokecube.rolycoly.dexDesc: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.
entity.pokecube.carkol.dexDesc: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
entity.pokecube.coalossal.dexDesc: It’s usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
entity.pokecube.coalossal-gmax.dexDesc: Its body is a colossal stove. With Gigantamax energy stoking the fire, this Pokémob’s flame burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
entity.pokecube.applin.dexDesc: As soon as it’s born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.
entity.pokecube.flapple.dexDesc: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.
entity.pokecube.flapple-gmax.dexDesc: If it stretches its neck, the strong aroma of its nectar pours out. The scent is so sickeningly sweet that one whiff makes other Pokémob faint.
entity.pokecube.appletun.dexDesc: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.
entity.pokecube.appletun-gmax.dexDesc: Due to Gigantamax energy, this Pokémob’s nectar has thickened. The increased viscosity lets the nectar absorb more damage than before.
entity.pokecube.silicobra.dexDesc: As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.
entity.pokecube.sandaconda.dexDesc: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.
entity.pokecube.sandaconda-gmax.dexDesc: Its sand pouch has grown to tremendous proportions. More than 1,000,000 tons of sand now swirl around its body.
entity.pokecube.cramorant.dexDesc: It’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.
entity.pokecube.cramorant-gorging.dexDes: This Cramorant has accidentally gotten a Pikachu lodged in its gullet. Cramorant is choking a little, but it isn’t really bothered.
entity.pokecube.cramorant-gulping.dexDes: Cramorant’s gluttony led it to try to swallow an Arrokuda whole, which in turn led to Cramorant getting an Arrokuda stuck in its throat.
entity.pokecube.arrokuda.dexDesc: After it’s eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. That’s when Cramorant swallows it up.
entity.pokecube.barraskewda.dexDesc: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.
entity.pokecube.toxel.dexDesc: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.
entity.pokecube.toxtricity-amped.dexDesc: This short-tempered and aggressive Pokémob chugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it might contain.
entity.pokecube.toxtricity-amped-gmax.de: Out of control after its own poison penetrated its brain, it tears across the land in a rampage, contaminating the earth with toxic sweat.
entity.pokecube.toxtricity-lowkey.dexDes: It has an electrical organ on its chest. While generating electricity, it fills its surroundings with what sounds like the strumming of a bass guitar.
entity.pokecube.toxtricity-lowkey-gmax.d: Its excessive electric energy is its weapon. This Pokémob can build up more electricity than any thundercloud.
entity.pokecube.sizzlipede.dexDesc: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.
entity.pokecube.centiskorch.dexDesc: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.
entity.pokecube.centiskorch-gmax.dexDesc: Gigantamax energy has evoked a rise in its body temperature, now reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. Its heat waves incinerate its enemies.
entity.pokecube.clobbopus.dexDesc: It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.
entity.pokecube.grapploct.dexDesc: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémob performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.
entity.pokecube.sinistea.dexDesc: It absorbs the life-force of those who drink it. It waits patiently, but opportunities are fleeting— it tastes so bad that it gets spat out immediately.
entity.pokecube.polteageist.dexDesc: Trainers Polteageist trusts will be allowed to experience its distinctive flavor and aroma firsthand by sampling just a tiny bit of its tea.
entity.pokecube.hatenna.dexDesc: If this Pokémob senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.
entity.pokecube.hattrem.dexDesc: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.
entity.pokecube.hatterene.dexDesc: If you’re too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémob is also known as the Forest Witch.
entity.pokecube.hatterene-gmax.dexDesc: Beams like lightning shoot down from its tentacles. It’s known to some as the Raging Goddess.
entity.pokecube.impidimp.dexDesc: It sneaks into people’s homes, stealing things and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.
entity.pokecube.morgrem.dexDesc: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it’s trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.
entity.pokecube.grimmsnarl.dexDesc: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémob can overwhelm even Machamp.
entity.pokecube.grimmsnarl-gmax.dexDesc: Gigantamax energy has caused more hair to sprout all over its body. With the added strength, it can jump over the world’s tallest building.
entity.pokecube.obstagoon.dexDesc: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.
entity.pokecube.perrserker.dexDesc: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémob lives for the thrill of battle.
entity.pokecube.cursola.dexDesc: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémob’s core spirit.
entity.pokecube.sirfetchd.dexDesc: Only Farfetch’d that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémob’s leek withers, it will retire from combat.
entity.pokecube.mr-rime.dexDesc: It’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.
entity.pokecube.runerigus.dexDesc: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.
entity.pokecube.milcery.dexDesc: This Pokémob was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.
entity.pokecube.alcremie.dexDesc: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.
entity.pokecube.alcremie-berry.dexDesc: The cells that compose its cream fluctuated suddenly during evolution, giving the cream a bitter flavor.
entity.pokecube.alcremie-gmax.dexDesc: Cream pours endlessly from this Pokémob’s body. The cream stiffens when compressed by an impact. A harder impact results in harder cream.
entity.pokecube.falinks.dexDesc: The six of them work together as one Pokémob. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.
entity.pokecube.pincurchin.dexDesc: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.
entity.pokecube.snom.dexDesc: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.
entity.pokecube.frosmoth.dexDesc: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.
entity.pokecube.stonjourner.dexDesc: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.
entity.pokecube.eiscue-ice.dexDesc: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.
entity.pokecube.eiscue-noice.dexDesc: The hair on its head connects to the surface of its brain. When this Pokémob has something on its mind, its hair chills the air around it.
entity.pokecube.indeedee-male.dexDesc: It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.
entity.pokecube.indeedee-female.dexDesc: They diligently serve people and Pokémob so they can gather feelings of gratitude. The females are particularly good at babysitting.
entity.pokecube.morpeko-full-belly.dexDe: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémob is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It’s also generating electricity.
entity.pokecube.morpeko-hangry.dexDesc: Intense hunger drives it to extremes of violence, and the electricity in its cheek sacs has converted into a Dark-type energy.
entity.pokecube.cufant.dexDesc: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It’s also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.
entity.pokecube.copperajah.dexDesc: These Pokémobs live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.
entity.pokecube.copperajah-gmax.dexDesc: So much power is packed within its trunk that if it were to unleash that power, the resulting blast could level mountains and change the landscape.
entity.pokecube.dracozolt.dexDesc: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.
entity.pokecube.arctozolt.dexDesc: This Pokémob lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.
entity.pokecube.dracovish.dexDesc: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.
entity.pokecube.arctovish.dexDesc: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémob go extinct anyway.
entity.pokecube.duraludon.dexDesc: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémob has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.
entity.pokecube.duraludon-gmax.dexDesc: It’s grown to resemble a skyscraper. Parts of its towering body glow due to a profusion of energy.
entity.pokecube.dreepy.dexDesc: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémob, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.
entity.pokecube.drakloak.dexDesc: Without a Dreepy to place on its head and care for, it gets so uneasy it’ll try to substitute any Pokémob it finds for the missing Dreepy.
entity.pokecube.dragapult.dexDesc: When it isn’t battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.
entity.pokecube.zacian.dexDesc: This Pokémob has slumbered for many years. Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others say the two Pokémob are rivals.
entity.pokecube.zacian-crowned.dexDesc: Able to cut down anything with a single strike, it became known as the Fairy King’s Sword, and it inspired awe in friend and foe alike.
entity.pokecube.zamazenta.dexDesc: In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.
entity.pokecube.zamazenta-crowned.dexDes: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master’s Shield. It was feared and respected by all.
entity.pokecube.eternatus.dexDesc: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémob and the Dynamax phenomenon.
entity.pokecube.eternatus-gmax.dexDesc: Infinite amounts of energy pour from this Pokémob’s enlarged core, warping the surrounding space-time.
entity.pokecube.kubfu.dexDesc: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.
entity.pokecube.urshifu-single-strike.de: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.
entity.pokecube.urshifu-rapid-strike.dex: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in defeating foes by raining many blows down on them. Its strikes are nonstop, flowing like a river.
entity.pokecube.urshifu-single-strike-gm: The energy released by this Pokémob’s fists forms shock waves that can blow away Dynamax Pokémob in just one hit.
entity.pokecube.urshifu-rapid-strike-gma: As it waits for the right moment to unleash its Gigantamax power, this Pokémob maintains a perfect one-legged stance. It won’t even twitch.
entity.pokecube.zarude.dexDesc: Within dense forests, this Pokémob lives in a pack with others of its kind. It’s incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémob of the forest fear it.
entity.pokecube.regieleki.dexDesc: This Pokémob is a cluster of electrical energy. It’s said that removing the rings on Regieleki’s body will unleash the Pokémob’s latent power.
entity.pokecube.regidrago.dexDesc: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.spectrier.dexDesc: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.
entity.pokecube.glastrier.dexDesc: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times harder than diamond.
entity.pokecube.calyrex.dexDesc: Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.
entity.pokecube.calyrex-ice.dexDesc: According to lore, this Pokémob showed no mercy to those who got in its way, yet it would heal its opponents’ wounds after battle.
entity.pokecube.calyrex-shadow.dexDesc: Legend says that by using its power to see all events from past to future, this Pokémob saved the creatures of a forest from a meteorite strike.
entity.pokecube.sneasler.dexDesc: Because of Sneasler’s virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.
entity.pokecube.overqwil.dexDesc: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname “sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.
entity.pokecube.wyrdeer.dexDesc: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémob is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.
entity.pokecube.kleavor.dexDesc: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone.
entity.pokecube.ursaluna.dexDesc: Hisui’s swampy terrain gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.
entity.pokecube.basculegion-male.dexDesc: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui’s rivers is Basculegion’s equal.
entity.pokecube.basculegion-female.dexDe: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui’s rivers is Basculegion’s equal.
entity.pokecube.enamorus-therian.dexDesc: The buds that ring its neck give off a spicy aroma that perks people up.
entity.pokecube.enamorus-incarnate.dexDe: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémob’s love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.
entity.pokecube.sprigatito.dexDesc: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémob frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.
entity.pokecube.floragato.dexDesc: The hardness of Floragato's fur depends on the Pokémob's mood. When Floragato is prepared to battle, its fur becomes pointed and needle sharp
entity.pokecube.meowscarada.dexDesc: This Pokémob uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating. With skillful misdirection, it rigs foes with pollen-packed flower bombs.
entity.pokecube.fuecoco.dexDesc: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy. Its flame sac is small, so energy is always leaking out.
entity.pokecube.crocalor.dexDesc: The combination of Crocalor’s fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémob’s head.
entity.pokecube.skeledirge.dexDesc: The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirge’s head gained a soul.
entity.pokecube.quaxly.dexDesc: Its strong legs let it easily swim around in even fast-flowing rivers. It likes to keep things tidy and is prone to overthinking things.
entity.pokecube.quaxwell.dexDesc: These Pokémobs constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.
entity.pokecube.quaquaval.dexDesc: Dancing in ways that evoke far-away places, this Pokémob mesmerizes all that see it. Flourishes of its decorative water feathers slice into its foes.
entity.pokecube.lechonk.dexDesc: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn’t use it for anything other than foraging.
entity.pokecube.oinkologne.dexDesc: Oinkologne is proud of its fine, glossy skin. It entrances female Pokémobs with the sweet, alluring scent from the tip of its tail that wafts from all over its body.
entity.pokecube.oinkologne-female.dexDes: This is a meticulous Pokémob that likes to keep things tidy. It shrouds itself in a floral aroma that soothes the Pokémobs around it.
entity.pokecube.dudunsparce.dexDesc: This Pokémob uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.
entity.pokecube.dudunsparce-three-segmen: The gentle Dudunsparce will put Pokémobs that wander into its nest onto its back and carry them to the entrance.
entity.pokecube.tarountula.dexDesc: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémob’s natural enemy.
entity.pokecube.spidops.dexDesc: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.
entity.pokecube.nymble.dexDesc: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it’s in a tough spot, this Pokémob jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
entity.pokecube.lokix.dexDesc: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.
entity.pokecube.rellor.dexDesc: This Pokémob creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
entity.pokecube.rabsca.dexDesc: The body that supports the cube barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémob is actually inside the cube.
entity.pokecube.greavard.dexDesc: It is said that a dog Pokémob that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémob. Pay it even the slightest bit of attention, and it will follow you forever.
entity.pokecube.houndstone.dexDesc: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémobs, this one is most loyal to its master.
entity.pokecube.flittle.dexDesc: It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.
entity.pokecube.espathra.dexDesc: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.
entity.pokecube.farigiraf.dexDesc: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémob is 10 times stronger than Girafarig’s.
entity.pokecube.wiglett.dexDesc: Though it looks like Diglett, Wiglett is an entirely different species. The resemblance seems to be a coincidental result of environmental adaptation.
entity.pokecube.wugtrio.dexDesc: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.
entity.pokecube.dondozo.dexDesc: This Pokémob is a glutton, but it’s bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.
entity.pokecube.veluza.dexDesc: Veluza has excellent regenerative capabilities. It sheds spare flesh from its body to boost its agility, then charges at its prey.
entity.pokecube.finizen.dexDesc: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.
entity.pokecube.palafin.dexDesc: Its physical capabilities are no different than a Finizen's, but when its allies are in danger, it transforms and powers itself up.
entity.pokecube.palafin-hero.dexDesc: This Pokémob’s ancient genes have awakened. It is now so extraordinarily strong that it can easily lift a cruise ship with one fin.
entity.pokecube.smoliv.dexDesc: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch. It can easily go a whole week without eating or drinking.
entity.pokecube.dolliv.dexDesc: It basks in the sun to its heart's content until the fruits on its head ripen. Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.
entity.pokecube.arboliva.dexDesc: This calm Pokémob is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémobs and drives back enemies by launching it at them with enough force to smash a boulder.
entity.pokecube.capsakid.dexDesc: Traditional Paldean dishes can be extremely spicy because they include the shed front teeth of Capsakid among their ingredients.
entity.pokecube.scovillain.dexDesc: The green head has turned vicious due to the spicy chemicals stimulating its brain. Once it goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.
entity.pokecube.tadbulb.dexDesc: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity, which it uses to float. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.
entity.pokecube.bellibolt.dexDesc: What appear to be eyeballs are actually organs for discharging the electricity generated by Bellibolt's belly-button dynamo when it expands and contracts its wobbly body.
entity.pokecube.varoom.dexDesc: It is said that this Pokémob was born when an unknown poison Pokémob entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.
entity.pokecube.revavroom.dexDesc: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders— now numbering eight—to generate energy.
entity.pokecube.orthworm.dexDesc: When attacked, this Pokémob will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
entity.pokecube.tandemaus.dexDesc: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.
entity.pokecube.maushold.dexDesc: The larger pair protects the little ones during battles. When facing strong opponents, the whole group will join the fight.
entity.pokecube.maushold-family-of-three: The little one just appeared one day. They all live together like a family, but the relationship between the three is still unclear.
entity.pokecube.cetoddle.dexDesc: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.
entity.pokecube.cetitan.dexDesc: This Pokémob wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.
entity.pokecube.frigibax.dexDesc: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.
entity.pokecube.arctibax.dexDesc: It attacks with the blade of its frozen dorsal fin by doing a front flip in the air. Arctibax's strong back and legs allow it to pull off this technique.
entity.pokecube.baxcalibur.dexDesc: This Pokémob blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.
entity.pokecube.tatsugiri.dexDesc: Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokémob. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner Dondozo to attack.
entity.pokecube.tatsugiri-droopy.dexDesc: This species’ differing colors and patterns are apparently the result of Tatsugiri changing itself to suit the preferences of the prey it lures in.
entity.pokecube.tatsugiri-stretchy.dexDe: It's one of the most intelligent dragon Pokémobs. It camouflages itself by inflating its throat sac.
entity.pokecube.cyclizar.dexDesc: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.
entity.pokecube.pawmi.dexDesc: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.
entity.pokecube.pawmo.dexDesc: Pawmo uses a unique fighting technique in which it uses its forepaws to strike foes and zap them with electricity from its paw pads simultaneously.
entity.pokecube.pawmot.dexDesc: This Pokémob normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.
entity.pokecube.wattrel.dexDesc: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémob dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
entity.pokecube.kilowattrel.dexDesc: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémob can fly over 430 miles in a day.
entity.pokecube.bombirdier.dexDesc: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémob’s chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.
entity.pokecube.squawkabilly-blue-plumag: Blue-feathered Squawkabilly view their green-feathered counterparts as rivals, since the latter make up the largest, most powerful groups.
entity.pokecube.squawkabilly.dexDesc: These Pokémobs prefer to live in cities. They form flocks based on the color of their feathers, and they fight over territory.
entity.pokecube.squawkabilly-white-pluma: This Pokémob dislikes being alone. It has a strong sense of community and survives by cooperating with allies.
entity.pokecube.squawkabilly-yellow-plum: These Squawkabilly are hotheaded, and their fighting style is vicious. They’ll leap within reach of their foes to engage in close combat.
entity.pokecube.flamigo.dexDesc: This Pokémob apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that the energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
entity.pokecube.klawf.dexDesc: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can’t remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
entity.pokecube.nacli.dexDesc: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
entity.pokecube.naclstack.dexDesc: This Pokémob dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey’s body.
entity.pokecube.garganacl.dexDesc: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémobs with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
entity.pokecube.glimmet.dexDesc: Glimmet's toxic mineral crystals look just like flower petals. This Pokémob scatters poisonous powder like pollen to protect itself.
entity.pokecube.glimmora.dexDesc: Glimmora's petals are made of crystallized poison energy. It has recently become evident that these petals resemble Tera Jewels.
entity.pokecube.shroodle.dexDesc: To keep enemies away from its territory, it paints markings around its nest using a poisonous liquid that has an acrid odor.
entity.pokecube.grafaiai.dexDesc: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémob eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.
entity.pokecube.fidough.dexDesc: This Pokémob is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough’s breath induces fermentation in the Pokémob’s vicinity.
entity.pokecube.dachsbun.dexDesc: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémob’s body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.
entity.pokecube.maschiff.dexDesc: Its well-developed jaw and fangs are strong enough to crunch through boulders, and its thick fat makes for an excellent defense.
entity.pokecube.mabosstiff.dexDesc: This Pokémob can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.
entity.pokecube.bramblin.dexDesc: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.brambleghast.dexDesc: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.
entity.pokecube.gimmighoul.dexDesc: This Pokémob was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure. Sometimes it gets left in shop corners since no one realizes it’s actually a Pokémob.
entity.pokecube.gimmighoul-roaming.dexDe: This Pokémob was born from passion that seeped into a coin. It wanders around, carrying it on its back. It survives by draining the life-force from humans who try to pick up the coin.
entity.pokecube.gholdengo.dexDesc: This Pokémob gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody. It has a sturdy body made up of stacked coins. Gholdengo overwhelms its enemies by firing coin after coin at them in quick succession.
entity.pokecube.great-tusk.dexDesc: Sightings of this Pokémob have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.
entity.pokecube.brute-bonnet.dexDesc: It bears a slight resemblance to a Pokémob described in a dubious magazine as a cross between a dinosaur and a mushroom.
entity.pokecube.sandy-shocks.dexDesc: It slightly resembles a Magneton that lived for 10,000 years and was featured in an article in a paranormal magazine.
entity.pokecube.scream-tail.dexDesc: It resembles a mysterious Pokémob described in a paranormal magazine as a Jigglypuff from one billion years ago.
entity.pokecube.flutter-mane.dexDesc: This Pokémob has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a ghostly pterosaur that was covered in a paranormal magazine, but the two have little else in common.
entity.pokecube.slither-wing.dexDesc: This Pokémob somewhat resembles an ancient form of Volcarona that was introduced in a dubious magazine.
entity.pokecube.roaring-moon.dexDesc: According to an article in a dubious magazine, this Pokémob has some connection to a phenomenon that occurs in a certain region.
entity.pokecube.iron-treads.dexDesc: This Pokémob closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.
entity.pokecube.iron-moth.dexDesc: This Pokémob resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.
entity.pokecube.iron-hands.dexDesc: This Pokémob shares many similarities with Iron Hands, a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.
entity.pokecube.iron-jugulis.dexDesc: It resembles a certain Pokémob introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.
entity.pokecube.iron-thorns.dexDesc: It has some similarities to a Pokémob introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.
entity.pokecube.iron-bundle.dexDesc: Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.
entity.pokecube.iron-valiant.dexDesc: It has some similarities to a mad scientist’s invention covered in a paranormal magazine.
entity.pokecube.ting-lu.dexDesc: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémob. It slowly brings its exceedingly heavy head down upon the ground, splitting the earth open with huge fissures that run over 160 feet deep.
entity.pokecube.chien-pao.dexDesc: The hatred of those who perished by the sword long ago has clad itself in snow and become a Pokémob. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.
entity.pokecube.wo-chien.dexDesc: The grudge of a person punished for writing the king’s evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokémob. It drains the life-force from vegetation, causing nearby forests to instantly wither and fields to turn barren.
entity.pokecube.chi-yu.dexDesc: The envy accumulated within curved beads that sparked multiple conflicts has clad itself in fire and become a Pokémob. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.
entity.pokecube.koraidon.dexDesc: This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.
entity.pokecube.miraidon.dexDesc: This seems to be the Iron Serpent mentioned in an old book. The Iron Serpent is said to have turned the land to ash with its lightning.
entity.pokecube.tinkatink.dexDesc: This Pokémob pounds iron scraps together to make a hammer. It will remake the hammer again and again until it's satisfied with the result.
entity.pokecube.tinkatuff.dexDesc: This Pokémob will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
entity.pokecube.tinkaton.dexDesc: The hammer tops 220 pounds, yet it gets swung around easily by Tinkaton as it steals whatever it pleases and carries its plunder back home.
entity.pokecube.charcadet.dexDesc: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémob. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents. It likes berries that are rich in fat.
entity.pokecube.armarouge.dexDesc: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that has been fortified by psychic and fire energy. This Pokémob is incredibly loyal, and it shoots blazing fireballs..
entity.pokecube.ceruledge.dexDesc: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal. Ceruledge cuts its enemies to pieces without mercy.
entity.pokecube.toedscool.dexDesc: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.
entity.pokecube.toedscruel.dexDesc: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.
entity.pokecube.kingambit.dexDesc: Though it commands a massive army in battle, it's not skilled at devising complex strategies. It just uses brute strength to keep pushing.
entity.pokecube.clodsire.dexDesc: When attacked, this Pokémob will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It’s a risky move that puts everything on the line.
entity.pokecube.annihilape.dexDesc: It imbues its fists with the power of the rage that it kept hidden in its heart. Opponents struck by these imbued fists will be shattered to their core.
entity.pokecube.walking-wake.dexDesc: It resembles a mysterious Pokémob described in a paranormal magazine as a Suicune from one billion years ago.
entity.pokecube.iron-leaves.dexDesc: It has some similarities to a Pokémob introduced in a dubious magazine as a Virizion from one billion years into the future.
